title: newParks Public Info Strategist
description:
Job Information


Job Requisition ID: 27160

Ministry: Environment & Parks

Location: Edmonton

Full or Part-Time: Full Time

Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week

Regular/Temporary: Temporary - 6 months

Scope: Open Competition

Closing Date: May 11, 2022

Classification: Subsidiary 02B 3625 Program Services 3

About Us



We support Albertans in being proud stewards of air, land, water, and biodiversity by leading the work required for the desired environmental outcomes and sustainable development of natural resources.


Role

Are you a creative individual who can bring public awareness to Alberta’s Provincial Parks? Environment and Parks is looking for someone who can combine their passion for the outdoors with their knowledge of strategic communications principles for our Parks Public Information Strategist.


The Parks Public Information Strategist prepares and distributes park and program information and promotional materials, which include providing related support services and online digital communications via social media, website content and a general online presence. As a key member of the Visitor Experience team, this role performs responsibilities in order to:


  • Raise awareness of Alberta Parks’ brand pillar values: Discover, Protect, Enjoy and Value.
  • Enhance the profile of provincial parks and protected areas.
  • Increase public awareness, stewardship and support of Alberta’s natural heritage and the benefits of preserving this heritage.
  • Promote nature-based tourism and outdoor recreation and increase visitation to Alberta’s parks & protected areas.
  • Coordinates, implements and evaluates the social media presence, online communications, internal communications, target public information initiatives and education activities.
  • Assist with media, education and outreach activities and events, and coordinates visitor’s experience team activities and campaigns.

To be successful in this role, you will be creative, have strong analytical and project planning skills, attention to detail, communication skills and have the ability to effectively prioritize multiple tasks. You will interact extensively with the public via social media and stakeholders.

Qualifications

The minimum requirements for this role are:


  • University graduation in Communications, Public relations, or related field, supplemented by a minimum of 2 years progressively responsible experience in a designated public relations, public affairs or public information position.

OR

  • Diploma in a Communications, Public Relations, or related field, supplemented by a minimum of 4 years progressively responsible experience in a designated public relations, public affairs, or public information position.

Equivalency: Directly related education or experience considered on the basis of: 1 year of education for 1 year of experience; or 1 year of experience for 1 year of education

Assets:

  • Demonstrated extensive knowledge of strategic communications principles, techniques, and practices
  • Demonstrated experience in creating, developing, implementing and evaluating innovative communication plans
  • Knowledge of the requirements of mass communication media and experience in allied fields such as advertising, printing, graphics, audio-visual, and web-based communications
  • Knowledge of Alberta's Parks system and management issues affecting provincial parks
  • Existing Alberta Parks legislative, regulatory and policy framework, stakeholders, current issues, and theoretical knowledge of policy development and stakeholder consultation

APS Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reaching our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in-depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.

The link below will assist you with understanding competencies:

In this role, you will contribute to our team by demonstrating the following behavioral competencies:


  • Build Collaborative Environments - Lead multi-agency working groups that may also include external stakeholders to develop policy outcomes and objectives to address department and Government of Alberta strategic policy needs.
  • Drive for Results - Lead a team of policy analysts toward development and amendments to legislation, regulations, disturbance standards, and directives that culminate in new or improved legislation supporting current Crown land policy needs.
  • Systems Thinking - Lead planning activities to develop team work policy priorities that are aligned with section, branch and department strategic directions.
  • Creative Problem Solving - Utilize people and leadership skills to build relationships across the department, ministries, agencies and external stakeholders to coordinate and facilitate problem solving such as resolving complex policy questions.
  • Develop Networks: Proactively building networks, connecting and building trust in relationships with different stakeholders.
  • Agility: Ability to anticipate, assess, and readily adapt to changing priorities, manage resilience in times of uncertainty and effectively work in a changing environment.
  • Other Relevant Attributes: Capability for public speaking; ability to navigate high-volume, fast-paced workloads; capacity to manage tight and coinciding timelines.

Salary

$2,613.91 to $3,428.61 bi-weekly: (approximately $66,714 to $87,586 per year)

Notes

These positions work Monday to Friday, 8:15 AM-4:30 PM, 36.25 hours a week.



In your resume, please include dates (including months and years) associated with all education and work experience. Also, please indicate whether your work experience is casual, part-time or full-time. For example January 15, 2006 - June 25, 2009: Assistant (PT three 8 hrs shifts/week).



This position will require final candidates to undergo a security clearance.


What we offer:

  • Working for the Alberta Public Service –
  • Pension plans:
    • Public Service Pension Plan (PSPP) –
  • Leadership and mentorship programs
  • Professional learning and development
  • Positive workplace culture and work-life balance

How To Apply



If you are not currently an employee with the Government of Alberta, the first step in applying for a job is creating your candidate profile within our online application system,



Existing employees should access the Career tile in 1GX to submit their application in order to be recognized as an internal applicant.


Once you have created your candidate profile, visit the Alberta Public Service job site to apply for jobs at


Tips for applicants:



It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS)

Closing Statement

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies, across the Government of Alberta, at the same or lower classification level.


We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.


If you require any further information on this job posting or a copy of the role profile, please contact Samantha Kith at samantha.kith@gov.ab.ca.


If this competition is closed as per the closing date noted above, please continue to check

title: Sales and Marketing Assistant
description:
Toronto, ON

The Exterminators Inc. are looking for a sales and marketing assistant to join our growing team. As a full-time marketing assistant, you would be working closely with our sales and advertising teams to support ongoing marketing projects and assist in the implementation of new marketing plans.

Role Overview:
Engage customers over the phone and online – answer written and oral inquiries
Create, curate and post content on web and social media channels
Organize information and input data, documenting sales and marketing initiatives
Responsibilities
Interact with customers to schedule appointments and measure customer satisfaction
Write and submit quotations
Create compelling copy for website and various social media mediums
Curate, edit and publish content – WordPress and social media channels
Help manage editorial calendar
Edit, organize and optimize photos
Handle general administrative functions as needed
Basic data entry
Some graphic design

Video editing skills a plus Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Business and/or marketing
1 year – 3 years’ experience in sales
1 year – 3 years’ experience in digital marketing
1 year – 3 years’ content marketing
Strong oral and written communication skills including proofreading
Proficiency in Excel, Word, Google Docs, Google Sheets and Google Drive
Proficiency in WordPress
Experience working with image editors
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Flexible hours with some evening and weekend availability Salary and Benefits
Full time salary
Health and Dental Benefits
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $36,000.00 to $45,000.00 /year – based on experience

We are an established but growing pest control and wildlife removal company servicing the Greater Toronto Area. We take pride in our work, enjoy helping customers and solving problems. We are ambitious but above all we are a team.

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Please apply with resume.

Salary: $36,000.00 to $45,000.00 /year

title: Recruitment Marketing Assistant – Remote
description:
Altasciences is a forward-thinking, mid-size contract research organization offering pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies a proven, flexible approach to preclinical and clinical pharmacology studies, including formulation, manufacturing and analytical services. For over 25 years, Altasciences has been partnering with sponsors to help support educated, faster, and more complete early drug development decisions. Altasciences’ integrated, full-service solutions include preclinical safety testing, clinical pharmacology and proof of concept, bioanalysis, program management, medical writing, biostatistics, and data management, all customizable to specific sponsor requirements. Altasciences helps sponsors get better drugs to the people who need them, faster.

The Recruitment Marketing Assistant will assist with recruitment marketing activities. The Recruitment Marketing Assistant will ensure all tasks performed are executed in compliance with study protocol, Good Clinical Practices (GCP) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)s.

Position based in Montreal - Remote | Full time position with benefits

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure the confidentiality of clinical trial participants and sponsors is respected.
  • Maintain and advocate a high level of customer service and quality within the department.
  • Update study postings on participant website & portal according to recruitment targets and study protocols/IFRs.
  • Update call center metrics.
  • Update recruitment agent metrics.
  • Verify referral program tracking.
  • Post ads on web classifieds.
  • Create and execute standard newsletters to participants according to the brand guide.
  • Provide agent and user support of participant portal.
  • Create IRB packages for advertising material for US sites.
  • Post online ads for US sites.
  • Act as an aid to the participant marketing team.
  • Perform recruitment calls and verify web registrations.
  • Proactively communicate issues and/or problem resolutions to departmental supervisors and managers.
  • Other tasks as assigned by departmental management.
Qualifications:
Educational:
High School Diploma or GED required; college degree and related work experience preferred.

Skills:
Good Communication (Advanced level of French and English),

Customer service focused, able to work in fast-paced environment.

Altasciences is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or any other protected grounds under applicable legislation. Reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities during the recruitment process are available upon request. Join us at Altasciences!

title: Temporary Administrative Assistant
description:
Golden West Broadcasting has been connecting communities for 65 years. We are proud to tell local stories on Sunny 94 and Lacombe Online. And together with Homefield, we are proud to help local businesses grow through effective advertising, marketing, and organizational development solutions.

We are looking for a Temporary Administrative Assistant to join our team. If you're a passionate individual who loves to help others, we want to hear from you!

In this role, you will:

-Answer phones and greet guests at the reception desk

-Enter contracts and commercial requests into the order system

-Provide general administrative support to the office

-Prepare proposals and presentations

You Are:

-Highly organized and have a keen attention to detail

-A team player: When your team is successful, you feel successful.

-A strong communicator, both verbally and in writing

-Tech savvy. Proficiency in Windows and Office are an asset.

-Positive and willing to learn

What we offer in return:

-A culture of innovation, adaptation, and acknowledgement.

-A strong focus on giving back to our communities.

-A caring environment where the health, safety, and well-being of our current and future team members is a priority.

-A diverse and respectful workplace; as an equal opportunity employer, we value and encourage diversity.

Even if you feel you don't meet enough criteria, we'd still love to meet you. Please reach out!
Golden West is an equal opportunity employer with a goal of finding and developing strong media professionals. We celebrate our people and our communities, and constantly look for new ways to connect our audience to the content that matters.

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Lacombe, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

  • When can you start?

Licence/Certification:

  • Drivers License (required)

We are seeking a Real Estate Assistant to join our growing team! Our commitment to providing the highest level of customer service has allowed us to build a thriving repeat and referral business. If you are passionate about creating the ultimate client care experience, are organized, professional, and relish in providing excellent customer service in an environment that encourages autonomy, initiative and idea-sharing - this may be the right fit for you! Applicants should be decisive, thorough, pay high attention to detail, and are excellent communicators. Interpersonal skills is a must! Ready to join the team? Start your application today!

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Purpose:
The Communications & Public Affairs Division (C&PA) is responsible for enhancing and protecting York University's brand and reputation. The division provides: strategic advice and counsel to York U senior management, develops and implements internal and external communication plans, manages media and public relations, strategic brand marketing and institutional advertising and develops and maintains strong working relationships with key constituency groups. C&PA includes the following units: Media Relations & External Communications, Strategic & Internal Communications, University Brand & Marketing and Business Intelligence & Planning. Reporting to the chief communications & marketing officer (CCMO) and the associate director, business intelligence & Planning (AD), the Executive Assistant (EA) assists the supervisors in the management, operations, and administration of the Division. It regularly requires exercise of independent judgment and comprehensive knowledge of the University, its programs, and personnel. S/he is responsible for effectively managing and scheduling the CCMO's time to ensure maintenance of an extensive standing meeting schedule as well as the flexibility to pursue an active agenda of priorities while maintaining the ability to react to quickly emerging issues. This position will facilitate the communication of information and directives across the Division and serves as the primary contact for all matters related to the CCMO's schedule and activities.

Education:
Community College diploma (University degree preferred) or equivalent combination of post secondary education and experience.

Experience:
Minimum 5 years of related experience providing executive or senior administrative support, with a proven record of high accomplishments in all areas of office management in a large-scale or complex operational environment involving multiple stakeholders. A thorough understanding of University structures, legislation, and procedures is essential. Experience developing compelling written and visual communications for a wide variety of audiences.

Skills:
Demonstrated excellent oral and written communication skills. exceptional organizational and multi-tasking skills to allow prioritizing of workload, working within tight timelines, and handling multiple projects simultaneously. Demonstrated sound judgment and initiative in resolving issues. Strong interpersonal skills. pleasant and professional phone manner. Ability to deal courteously, professionally and effectively with people. demonstrated initiative and flexibility. Demonstrated ability to handle highly sensitive, political issues with diplomacy, tact, sensitivity and integrity. Knowledge of protocols and social etiquette. Proven ability to work calmly and effectively under pressure of high volume of work and changing priorities. Ability and desire to work independently, as well as in a strong team atmosphere. Awareness of political sensitivities and the diverse interests of stakeholders. Proven ability to work with senior leadership and external stakeholders. Project coordination experience including process and system improvement and development. Demonstrated proficiency in using computerized scheduling software. Experience of MS Word (Advanced), Excel (Basic) and PowerPoint (Intermediate). Working knowledge of Google docs, Doodle Poll, Survey Monkey and internet researching. A high level of professionalism and confidentiality in dealing with sensitive information. Ability to adapt to change and learn new applications.

Additional Notes:
Office environment. Standard day (9:00 to 5:00). Some evening work may be required. High pressure of volume, with numerous competing time demands. Handling time sensitive materials and confidential information. Juggling competing priorities on a frequent basis. Occasional travel throughout the university will be required, usually involving pick-up and delivery of critical supplies and correspondence between departments or on behalf of the department. Please note: This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credentials(s), or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview.



  • Compensation:
York implemented a revised CPM Compensation Framework in 2019. The Framework is a salary grid consisting of 6 or 8 steps (depending on job grade) which is reviewed annually with possible adjustments, and a lump sum Performance Based Recognition Award. Employees will receive the grid adjustment and depending on performance, eligible permanent employees may move to the next step of the grid and may receive a lump sum Performance Based Recognition Award.Visit the CPM Compensation page on the HR Website to find out more about York's CPM Compensation Program.
The University welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, including, but not limited to women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities (racialized), Indigenous Peoples and persons of any gender identity and sexual orientation. York University is committed to a positive, supportive and inclusive environment.

York University offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities in its recruitment processes. If you are contacted by York University regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if you require accommodation.

We are committed to enhancing our environmentally and socially responsible practices for the benefit of all members of the York community. Our long term perspective recognizes our responsibility to be innovators and to continually work as a community to reduce our ecological impact.

York University employees must apply to jobs through the Employee Career Portal - YU Hire. If you are a current York University employee and/or are using your rights under a collective agreement to view and/or apply to jobs, you MUST log into YU Hire to access the York University Employee Career Portal.

PLEASE NOTE: Applications must be received by 11:55 pm EST on the posted deadline date, if applicable.

title: Assistant Editor
description:
WHO WE ARE

Sid Lee is a borderless creative agency applying storytelling, design and technology to build customer experiences that matter. Their multi-disciplinary team of 900 professionals works as one, out of offices in Montreal, Toronto, New York, Paris, London, LA and Seattle. Working side by side with progressive clients, they deploy their creative capabilities in several disciplines, ranging from design to interactive and experiential communication to advertising and architecture. Practicing agile creative and production development, as well as radical collaboration both internally and with their clients, they create work that matters, allowing their clients to outperform their competitors and earn the trust and loyalty of their customers.

ROLE

The Assistant Editor will work closely with the Toronto post-production team and with the Montreal assistant editor team. You will play an integral role in the team, helping to ensure that all post projects run smoothly. You will also be given projects to edit yourself and will be expected to be creatively forward thinking. The Assistant Editor reports to the Creative Director – Post-Production.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manage projects in the editing rooms: import/logging/process logs/etc.
  • Perform technical review of camera sources.
  • Compress videos in various formats according to customer specifications.
  • Be the editor's technical support during work sessions.
  • Meet the import/export needs during editing sessions, or any other editor's requests.
  • Build, manage and distribute all elements of the final stages for use in the audio mix, colour transfer, final graphics, VFX and CG work.
  • Perform verification and quality control of the edits ensuring consistency.
  • Ensure, when a project is done, to clean it up in order to archive it.
  • Create final deliverables in various resolutions and video/audio codecs (ie. UHD, HD, 9:16, 1:1, 4:5 etc.).
  • Review and select footage to start to visualize and create edits based on scripts.
  • Train new assistants in technical and non-technical daily tasks.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Knowledge of software Adobe Premiere Pro CC and Avid Media Composer.
  • Knowledge of Da Vinci Resolve, Flame and After Effect CC and Adobe Creative Suite an asset.
  • Knowledge of different video codec.
  • General knowledge of film and video post-production.
  • Technical knowledge of post-production equipment (camera, machine room, patch).
  • Experience in managing raw camera media, transcoding, syncing and adding LUTs in DaVinci Resolve for use in Adobe Premiere and Avid Media Composer.
  • General knowledge of different cameras on the market an asset.
  • Has a “creative eye.”
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to continue upgrading skills and knowledge independently.
  • Tolerance to stress.
  • Attention to detail.
  • 3-4 years of experience as an Assistant Editor.
  • Portfolio of past edit work.

Proud to be an equal opportunity employer, Sid Lee is committed to creating a diverse work environment. All qualified applicants are considered without regard to citizenship, ethnicity, race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, disability, age or veteran status.
We encourage women, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
Celebright is looking for an experienced Marketing Assistant to help grow our footprint across North America. Based in Kanata, Celebright designs, manufactures and installs permanent holiday lighting systems. The Marketing Assistant will help facilitate marketing initiatives to grow the Celebright brand, both locally and internationally.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Help Create marketing strategies and test campaigns for use in both Ottawa and throughout our North American dealer network
  • Manage social media platforms and leverage them to grow our brand
  • Gather, analyze and report analytics and marketing data
  • Perform market research and apply findings to future marketing campaigns.
  • Assist sales staff in dealer acquisition and support.
  • Work with both new and existing dealers to create and implement marketing strategies and offer support.
  • Collaborate closely with other departments such as sales, dealer network, and production.

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Direct marketing
  • Market research & segmentation
  • Project planning & coordination
  • Reporting research results
  • Strong computer skills
  • Basic graphic design skills an asset
  • Excellent proofing and editing abilities
  • Ability to multi-task and be highly organized at the same time
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Courteous and just generally nice to be around

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or a related field
  • Proven working experience in digital marketing
  • Demonstrable experience leading and managing SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media and advertising campaigns
  • Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform, and motivate
  • Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
  • Solid knowledge of website and marketing analytics tools
  • Working knowledge of ad serving tools
  • Strong social media knowledge using social media platforms, posting and engaging with customers

Compensation:

  • Salary to be negotiated based on successful applicant's skill set and experience
  • Bonus: annual bonus for company profit sharing
  • Benefits: Health, Dental, Vision + Life Insurance

Location:

  • Hybrid position with part time in office and part work from home.
  • Office is located in Kanata

About Celebright:
Celebright is a Fast Growing, Ottawa based company. We design permanent holiday lighting systems, which combine custom lighting controller hardware with industry leading cloud based control. We’re a tight knit group of nice people, with a focus on creating quality products and delivering an excellent customer experience.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: newAdministrative Assistant
description:
Here at Scotts Miracle-Gro there is no such thing as a typical day. Our culture is constantly energized by new and exciting growth opportunities and at a rapid pace. Every Associate plays an important role in providing innovative solutions for today’s gardeners and growers and contributing new ideas to improve operations. In our company you need grit, it is what we were founded on over 150 years ago and is what keeps us growing. Regardless of your level in the organization there is a platform for your voice to be heard and the ability to influence change. Family, community and hard working values are weaved into all that we do. Come grow with us, where we develop and nurture the next generation of leaders.
This Administrative Assistant serves as an initial point of contact to the Plant and is responsible for the management and control of a wide range of complex and confidential administrative, operational, and support tasks for the Site. The incumbent manages sensitive information and ensures seamless delivery of services to the Site office. The nature of the work requires close and integrated coordination with other members of the Site office team and liaising with various internal and external parties.
The Administrative Assistant may be required to work on holidays and weekends from time to time.
Specific Accountabilities:
Provide administrative support and assistance to the Office Manager and Site Manager. Responsible for assisting with site i.e., uniforms, office supplies.
Responsible for assisting with the organization and maintenance of confidential files.
Preparation and presentation of new hire documents, including participating in orientations.
May be required to assist with payroll functions including timecard corrections and reporting.
Responsible for logging invoices as well as ensuring the corresponding paperwork is attached to the invoices.
Coordinate with Office Manager or Site Manager regarding queries on invoices.
Responsible for contacting employees regarding any schedule changes. Responsible for printing, posting, collecting, and filing of SOP’s.
Ensure that scheduled periodic reporting is sent out on time and accurately. Assist employees on filing expense reports, secure necessary approvals and submit for reimbursement.
Coordinate meetings for Office Manager and/or Site Manager and take minutes when required.
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and share with appropriate stakeholders.
Carry out any additional duties as assigned.
Requisite Qualifications:
Post-secondary education in Office Administration with a minimum of 2 years related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written. Superior customer service skills with ability to handle complaints and communicate calmly and professionally.
Good working knowledge of computer applications such as the MS Office Suite.
Superior time management and organizational skills with keen attention to detail.
Positive, team-oriented attitude and ability to work with minimal supervision and solve problems.
Ability to handle confidential materials in a sensitive and appropriate manner. Reliable, responsible and adaptable to change and learning new tasks.
Fluency in both official languages would be considered an asset.
Aperçu du poste:
Cet assistant administratif sert de point de contact initial à l'usine et est responsable de la gestion et du contrôle d'un large éventail de tâches administratives, opérationnelles et de soutien complexes et confidentielles pour le site. Le titulaire gère des informations sensibles et assure une prestation de services sans faille au bureau du site. La nature du travail exige une coordination étroite et intégrée avec les autres membres de l'équipe du bureau du site et une liaison avec diverses parties internes et externes.
L'assistant administratif peut être amené à travailler les jours fériés et les week-ends de temps à autre.
Responsabilités spécifiques :
Fournir un soutien administratif et une assistance au directeur du bureau et au directeur du site.
Responsable de l'assistance au site, c'est-à-dire des uniformes et des fournitures de bureau.
Contribuer à l'organisation et à la tenue des dossiers confidentiels.
Préparation et présentation des documents des nouveaux employés, y compris la participation aux orientations.
Il peut être nécessaire d'aider aux fonctions de paie, y compris les corrections des fiches de présence et les rapports.
Consigner les factures et s'assurer que les documents correspondants sont joints aux factures.
Coordonner avec le chef de bureau ou le chef de site les demandes de renseignements sur les factures.
Contacter les employés pour tout changement d'horaire.
Responsable de l'impression, de l'affichage, de la collecte et du classement des procédures opérationnelles standard. S
'assurer que les rapports périodiques prévus sont envoyés à temps et avec précision.
Aider les employés à remplir les rapports de dépenses, obtenir les approbations nécessaires et les soumettre pour remboursement.
Coordonner les réunions pour le directeur de bureau et/ou le directeur de site et rédiger les procès-verbaux si nécessaire.
Maintenir la confidentialité des informations sensibles et les partager avec les parties prenantes appropriées.
Effectuer toutes les autres tâches qui lui sont confiées.
Qualifications requises:
Formation postsecondaire en administration de bureau avec un minimum de deux ans d'expérience connexe ou une combinaison équivalente d'études et d'expérience.
Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et de communication, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit.
Compétences supérieures en matière de service à la clientèle, capacité à traiter les plaintes et à communiquer avec calme et professionnalisme.
Bonne connaissance pratique des applications informatiques telles que la suite MS Office.
Compétences supérieures en matière de gestion du temps et d'organisation, avec un grand souci du détail.
Attitude positive, esprit d'équipe et capacité à travailler avec un minimum de supervision et à résoudre des problèmes.
Capacité à traiter des documents confidentiels de manière sensible et appropriée.
Fiabilité, responsabilité et capacité d'adaptation au changement et à l'apprentissage de nouvelles tâches.
La maîtrise des deux langues officielles serait considérée comme un atout.
COME GROW WITH US, WHERE THE GRASS REALLY IS GREENER!

Not interested in this role? Check out our other career opportunities and learn more about what it’s like to work at Scotts MiracleGro by accessing our Talent Network:
SMG Talent Network


The Scotts Miracle-Gro Company (NYSE: SMG) is the world's largest marketer of branded consumer lawn and garden products, with a full range of products for professional horticulture as well. Scotts Miracle-Gro has helped to grow the nearly $7 billion global consumer lawn and garden market through product innovation, industry-leading advertising efforts and its trusted brands.

The brands and products within our portfolio include: Scotts, Miracle-Gro, TomCat, Ortho, RoundUp, Bonnie Plants, Osmocote, Earthgro and Fafard.

Scotts is an EEO Employer.

Notification to Agencies:

Please note that the Scotts Miracle-Gro company does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Master Service Agreement, and specific approval to submit resumes to an approved requisition, the Scotts Miracle-Gro company will not consider or approve payment regarding recruiter fees or referral compensations.

title: Pharmacy Assistant
description:
• Assist pharmacist and pharmacy technician to process prescriptions
  • Greet customers and answer basic questions
  • Be familiar with stocked medication
  • Defer to pharmacist for more complex inquiries
  • Input customer and prescription information into computer system
  • Help gather and bag prescriptions
  • Answer phones in a professional manner
  • Tend to emails and fax messages
  • Take and track inventory, restocking when needed
  • Assist in organizing and shelving medicine
  • Accept and process deliveries
  • Provide on demand and scheduled deliveries of medications to patients and facilities
  • Assist with billing needs
  • Perform various administration duties as needed (filing, copying forms, till counting, etc.)
  • Manage cash register and complete transactions
  • Stock shelves, counters or tables with merchandise
  • Set up advertising displays or arrange merchandise on counters or tables to promote sales.
  • Stamp, mark or tag prices on merchandise.
  • Obtain merchandise requested by customer or receive merchandise selected by customer.
  • Answer customer questions concerning location, price and use of merchandise.
  • Total price and tax on merchandise purchased by customer to determine bill.
  • Accept payment and make change. Wrap or bag merchandise for customers.
  • Remove and record amount of cash in register at end of shift.
  • Manage sales discount to determine price.
  • Keep record of sales, prepare inventory of stock and order merchandise.
  • Keep the Retail and Dispensary area clean and orderly.
  • Attend FedEx Ship Centre, wish local and Amazon hub counter Customers

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00-$17.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Education:

  • DCS / DEC (preferred)

Experience:

  • Retail sales: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 5 Driving License (preferred)

Willingness to travel:

  • 25% (preferred)

title: Assistant Manager - Montreal Eaton
description:
HUGO BOSS is one of the leading premium fashion and lifestyle companies with around 14,600 employees worldwide. As the most important interface for our customers, you will demonstrate your passion for our products and act as a brand ambassador for HUGO BOSS. Join a team that provides an exceptional brand and shopping experience with enthusiasm, fun and expertise – because, to create something extraordinary, we must explore new paths together. Shape your own future at HUGO BOSS!

Assistant Manager - Montreal Eaton
HUGO BOSS Canada, Inc. | Montreal | Canada | Full-time

Convey a positive impression of HUGO BOSS to the marketplace by delivering an exceptional shopping experience, showcasing the brand through exciting merchandise presentations and executing operational strategies resulting in positive operating profits.


What you can expect:

  • Utilize effective communication skills in training and developing staff, delivering exceptional service to customers, driving business with the merchant group and general problem solving.
  • Lead the team to achieve positive results by supporting top line sales, profit and loss management and inventory control.
  • Establish a goal oriented selling culture that focuses on relationship selling, building a client base and exceptional service.
  • Ensure compliance with all policies and procedures through regular store management and staff meetings, store walk-through and audits.
  • Monitor performance, provide direction, and take corrective action when needed.
  • Cultivate a relationship with the community via personal involvement, PR events and advertising opportunities.
  • Continually evaluate and react to performance issues and actively recruit candidates.
  • Ability to work varied hours/days to oversee store operations.
  • Ensure all relevant conditions relating to Health & Safety are fulfilled and empower store staff to achieve the highest standards to support store management within this area.
  • Knowledgeable in all Health & Safety policies and procedures.
  • Ensure all documentation relating to Health & Safety are well recorded and maintained.

Your profile:

Minimum Education (or substitute experience) required:

  • BS College Degree preferred or equivalent experience

Minimum Experience required:

  • 2-3 years of Specialty Retail Management experience

Skills Required:

  • Excellent organizational, time management, analytical, and leadership skills
  • Independent, self-motivated, detail-oriented, entrepreneurial
  • Strong business acumen and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to process information and merchandise through computer system and POS register system.
  • Ability to communicate with associates and guests.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office

Your benefits:

  • International and inspirational working environment
  • Career progression opportunities
  • Dynamic and inspirational work culture
  • Flexible scheduling to meet lifestyle needs, with a competitive compensation program and a fun working environment

title: Administrative & Human Resources Assistant
description:
Learning Disabilities Association of Toronto District (LDATD)

The Learning Disabilities Association of Toronto District (LDATD) is a chapter of the Learning Disabilities Association of Ontario (LDAO) serving the amalgamated City of Toronto. LDATD is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to creating a society in which people with learning disabilities (LDs) and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) are able to achieve the full expression of their intellect and abilities.

LDATD is seeking a dynamic Administrative & Human Resources Assistantto support the organization through a period of exciting growth and organizational development in administration

Areas of Responsibilities:

· Process, verify and register documentation relating to personnel activities such as maintaining staffing levels, recruitment, orientation, training, performance evaluations, classifications, onboarding and terminations

· Liaise with agency’s HR Consultants, Financial Consultants and IT Consultants as required

· Support policy administrative process and procedures, computerized filing and registration systems,

· Compile information, prepare reports relating to personnel activities from administrative systems

· Transition LDATD manual files to electronic platforms in Bright HR

· Support the role out of agency policies and procedures as required

· Provide solid knowledge of administrative practices, business systems such as filing/storage systems, maintaining electronic databases, maintaining office procedures like ordering supplies, mail distribution, minutes, messages, etc

· Respond to telephone and written enquiries for information from staff teams and external stakeholders as needed

· Arrange for advertising or posting of job vacancies, assist in screening and rating and scoring of job applicants, and conduct reference checks and follow up

· Arrange for internal and external training activities, special events

· Support H&S committee and Work Life Committee initiatives

· Conduct new employee orientations and prepare employee communications as required

· Provide status updates on pertinent information to supervisors on a weekly basis, at team meetings, or as the need arises

· Consult and provide support to the SMT and staff teams, attend meetings as needed and stream communication as required

· Provide a safe, respectful, unbiased, and non-judgmental approach with alignment to the agency’s core values

· Assist with various special HR, administrative projects, initiatives, and

· Other assigned duties

Qualifications, Experience and Skills:

· Post-secondary education in related field and 1-3 years HR Assistant experience

· Certified Human Resources Professional (CHRP) is an asset

· A broad knowledge of the principles and practices of Human Resources role, responsibilities, processes and procedures

· Good knowledge and skills in computer software packages and programs such as word processing, spreadsheet, presentation (e.g. Microsoft Office Suite, excel, word, powerpoint, outlook, Zoom, data base management etc).

· Exceptional organizational and time management skills to multi-task and prioritize

· Excellent verbal, written and listening communication and interpersonal skills to respond to a variety of inquiries

· Proven business acumen and ability to handle sensitive information confidentially

· Demonstrated ability to work independently and in a team environment in a quick paced environment

· HighlyProfessional, committed and reliable

· Able to take initiative, use critical thinking and problem solving skills

· Flexible and adaptable to handle new responsibilities as agency business develops

· A clear Vulnerable Sector’s Criminal Record Check(less than 1 year old)

TERMS:

Work hours:

- Regular work week: (Full Time);

- Start date: ASAP

- Rate: TBD

- Renewable contract position, reports to Executive Director

Location:

- Within LDATD offices/program locations in North York

To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter and a list of three professional references to us with subject line: Admin & HR Assistant

Deadline for submissions: Until filled

Note: The Agency conducts continuous interviews (telephone screening and personal interviews) and will hire the first suitable candidate. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest. Only those candidates selected for interviews will be conducted.

LDATD is an inclusive employer committed to ensuring accessibility. If you require accommodations to attend an interview, please contact us.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $18.00-$23.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • human resources: 1 year (preferred)

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Job Listing: Executive Assistant | Toronto based Marketing Agency

Position: Executive Assistant

Location: Toronto, ON

Job Type: Full time

Company Overview

Verta Marketing is an independent end-to-end solution marketing and media agency based in Toronto, Ontario. We manage partnerships and clients of all different sizes and scopes, and from a wide range of industries. Verta primarily operates under the agency of record model, working with its clients to provide a solution for both creative and lead generation marketing.

Verta Marketing’s high standard of excellence is built on a foundation of strong leadership with an extraordinary team and a “can do” spirit. Our team is composed of creatives, innovators, strategists, influencers, and difference makers all driven by the goal of doing great work.

Our brand promise is to guide our clients with expertise along the right marketing path by consistently delivering growth solutions and exceptional service. We pride ourselves on utilizing our distinct skill sets to help bring results that our clients can get excited about.

Due to our recent partnership with a venture capital firm, we are in a unique situation where we are looking to expand our team and build a stronger foundation for our growing agency.

Job Description

Verta Marketing is looking to hire a full time Executive Assistant (Intern) who will be working along side the CEO and will be responsible to manage schedules & communications on their behalf both, internally & externally. This is a 4 month internship opportunity with the possibility of transitioning to full time upon successful completion.
This is also an exciting role to learn and grow within a fast paced agency environment.

As an Executive Assistant at Verta Marketing, you would be responsible for:

  • Account management duties on behalf of client(s) and Verta Marketing;
  • Assisting on business development related duties;
  • Social media content management, copywriting and posts;
  • Assistance in brainstorming ideas for advertising and marketing content;
  • Providing administrative and general support to Design and Marketing teams;
  • Media/video producing/administrating;
  • Managing and organizing Verta executive's emails, platform technologies, and client related conversations;
  • Tasks relating to operations, human resources, finance, sales, marketing;
  • Other duties that are considered reasonable and are customarily performed by an intern in the industry of the Company;
  • Other related duties as may be required.

Qualifications

Need-to-Have

  • Experience in handling administrative duties & responsibilities
  • Background in marketing/social media//communications/public relations
  • Superior communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong interpersonal and highly developed relationship management skills
  • Demonstrated writing skills for various formats and channels
  • Outstanding copyediting and proofreading skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently in a fast-paced production environment with multiple overlapping deadlines

Nice-to-Have

  • Strong preference will be given to those who have experience marketing for the following sectors: Satellite Technology, financial investment, e-commerce, automotive, and telecommunication
  • Experience managing social media accounts on behalf of clients
  • Graphic design skills
  • Experience assisting with the production of annual reports and newsletters

title: Recruiting Assistant
company: Tim Hortons | Saisethsons Hospitality Group Inc.
description:
With the growth of our business, we are looking for a Recruiter Assistant. In your role as the Recruiter Assistant, you are a KEY SUPPORTER and will be responsible in supporting all the Recruitment, On-boarding, Administrative functions as well as Ad-hoc HR projects across all of our restaurants in Toronto & GTA.

As a Recruitment Assistant you must always lead by example by living the Seth culture with all interactions you have in the company with management, new and existing team members and to help reduce turnover within the organization by keeping our current workforce happily engaged with the team.


Job Responsibilities:


  • Advertising job opportunities and reviewing the applications in a timely manner.
  • Screening and reviewing applications and resumes and calling potential candidates in for interviews using your knowledge, experience and judgment to see if they would be a good fit with the team. You will also facilitate background checks if required.
  • Interviewing candidates and using the ‘Seth Family Ways’, our company Core Values as your principal means of understanding if the new team member would be the right fit in the organization if required.
  • Support On-boarding sessions with the selected candidates.
  • Help on-board the new hires in the restaurant using our Welcome Kit and help the restaurant with their training if necessary.
  • Preparing or updating employment records related to hiring, transferring, promoting, and terminating.
  • Following up with the new team members to ensure the training is going well and get to know their initial thoughts on their job. Following up with the Managers to get feedback about the new team members and communicate and/or take any further action required.
  • Staying up to date with all the company wide internal initiatives and Tim Hortons operational updates and communicating the information to the Team Members, Binder Champions, Supervisors and Managers.


REQUIREMENTS

  • Be available to work flexible shifts and weekends.
  • Have at least 1 year of experience in food service industry or other related fields.
  • Be guest service oriented and committed to deliver exceptional guest experience.
  • Have strong organizational and communication skills and a lot of patience
  • Embrace our Servant leadership model to positively train, communicate and help team members.
  • Pride yourself in building relationships with your guests and your team.
  • Demonstrate a passion for leading, coaching and serving your team.
  • Having a driver license and your own vehicle is an asset.
  • Be willing to commute to multiple restaurants when needed
  • Have or currently pursuing a post-secondary degree/diploma focused on Human Resources is an asset.


Tim Hortons - Saisethsons Hospitality Group Inc.


Why working with us?

We are a franchisee group operating Tim Hortons and believe in long term career paths and promoting from within. We strive to be well-known for our unique approach to hospitality. With a portfolio of more than 60 restaurants across the GTA, we have been providing our team with growth opportunities for those constant in their efforts in service improvement, training and development and belief in Servant leadership philosophy. You will find yourself in one of the best teams that work together and have fun together.

title: newCommunications and Marketing Assistant
description:
Summer Job with Centre for Skills Development

Are you entrepreneurial, client-focused and committed to teamwork and excellence? Do you enjoy working with clients from diverse backgrounds? If you want to work for a recognized leader in career and workforce development, then consider a career with Centre for Skills Development!

Headquartered in Burlington, Ontario, with locations in Oakville, Milton and Clarkson, Centre for Skills delivers high caliber employment services, language training & immigrant services, skilled trades training and literacy upgrading. Providing people with opportunities to build a better future and making a positive impact on peoples’ lives is integral to the business of Centre for Skills.

For more information, visit: centreforskills.ca

The Opportunity

Job Number: 370

Job Title: Communications & Marketing Assistant

Department: Administration

Location: Virtual

Contract Length: 12 weeks starting in June 2022

Schedule: Full-time (35 hours/week)

Hours of Work: Monday to Friday, 8:30am – 4:30pm

Salary: $15.00 per hour

These are your responsibilities:

· Gather, research and prepare communications material for internal and external audiences.

· Assist in the development and implementation of advertising campaigns appropriate for print or electronic media.

· Assist in collecting and analyzing information on social media channels.

· Assist in content development for blogs, newsletters and social media.

· Create promotional materials like posters, brochures and social media posts.

· Provide administrative support to the Communications & Marketing and Human Resources teams.

· Participate in the planning and execution of health & wellness and personal leadership committee initiatives.

What you need to bring to this job:

· Under Canada Summer Jobs (CSJ) guidelines, to be eligible, applicants must:

  • be between 15 and 30 years of age (inclusive) at the start of the employment
  • be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act; and
  • be legally entitled to work in Canada in accordance with relevant provincial or territorial legislation and regulations

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team

· Strong communication skills, both written and verbal

· Flexible, adaptable and detail-oriented

· Proficient with MS Office: Word, Excel and Outlook and working knowledge of virtual meeting platforms such as Zoom

· Past experience in a similar role will be considered an asset

How to apply:

Please e-mail your resume and cover letter to: resumes at centreforskills.ca

Application Deadline: May 10, 2022

We thank all applicants for their interest in Centre for Skills, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If contacted for an interview, please inform us should accommodation be required.

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 12 weeks

Salary: $15.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • On-site parking
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Are you between 15 and 30 years of age? This is a requirement under the Canada Summer Jobs guidelines.
  • Are you a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act? This is a requirement under the Canada Summer Jobs guidelines.
  • Are you legally entitled to work in Canada in accordance with relevant provincial or territorial legislation and regulations? This is a requirement under the Canada Summer Jobs Guidelines.

Application deadline: 2022-05-10

title: newCanada Summer Jobs - Marketing Assistant
description:
Under the 2022 Canada Summer Jobs program, iHuman is currently recruiting for a:

MARKETING ASSISTANT

The Organization

iHuman Youth Society is a non-profit organization whose mission is to serve marginalized youth to promote their inclusion in the community through a program involving crisis intervention, arts, mentorship, and life skills development.

The Position

This is a temporary (8 week), full-time position under the Canada Summer Jobs Program.

Working directly with the Marketing Communications Manager, this position will assist with start-to-finish marketing communication and promotion strategies.

You will be responsible for:

  • The analysis, development, and implementation of information programs.
  • The analysis of advertising needs and the development of appropriate advertising and marketing plans.
  • The publicizing of iHuman activities and events through print and digital media.
  • The planning, coordination, and execution of fundraising campaigns. - the maintenance of (social) media relations on behalf of iHuman's not-for-profit society.

The Candidate

  • Post secondary education is preferred
  • Must be between ages 15 to 30 (inclusive) to qualify for the Canada Summer Jobs program
  • Satisfactory Vulnerable Sectors Check
  • Experience working with high-risk youth and/or youth with special needs is an asset
  • Cultural Competency and/or Indigenous Studies an asset
  • Arts (visual, music, performance, dance, fashion, fine arts) experience and education is an asset
  • Administrative experience is an asset
  • Computer competency with Mac and PC

Hours of Work: Full Time (37.5 hours/week) 10:00am - 6:00pm - Some evenings and weekend hours may be required.

Salary: $18 per hour

We appreciate your application. However, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: $18.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-05-14

title: (Canada) Evening Data Entry (Remote)
description:
Remote work from home administrative assistant, data entry clerk, typing, customer service representative, get started now.

Thank you for checking us out! Work From Home Data Entry Jobs - Part-time, Full-time

We are seeking individuals who are looking for part time or full-time work or side gigs to be connected with companies that are hiring employees directly to work from their homes. You will find both full-time and also part-time remote opportunities in a variety of career fields.

Legitimate Work From Home Data Entry Jobs are going to require that you have skills appropriate to the position you are looking for. Training is given based upon the position.

Job Requirements
  • Computer with net access
  • Silent work space away from distractions
  • Should be able as well as comfortable to working in an environment without immediate supervision
  • Capacity to read, comprehend, and follow oral and also written instructions.
  • Data entry or administrative assistant experience is not needed but can be a bonus
  • We are hiring those who have a history in health care, storage facility worker, delivery drivers, customer service, etc - we invite all backgrounds as long as you're ready to learn
You should apply on our website only.

Job Needs
  • Typing 25+ words per min
  • You enjoy data entry work as well as can do the work from your home or location of choosing (remote work at home job)
  • Computer with net access
  • It is critical that you be self-motivated and able to follow explicit instructions to start working from home
  • Self Motivated - you must be 100% able to commit to collaborating with little supervision
  • Work from home jobs of this nature need Web and one of the following: Laptop or PC, MAC, or Smart Device - Android or IOS
Ready to get going? Start today as well as earn money next week.

Thanks for checking us out and we look forward to helping you attain your goals!

  • Data entry or administrative assistant experience is not needed but can be a bonus
  • We are hiring those who have a history in health care, storage facility worker, delivery drivers, customer service, etc - we invite all backgrounds as long as you're ready to learn
You should apply on our website only.

Job Needs
  • Typing 25+ words per min
  • You enjoy data entry work as well as can do the work from your home or location of choosing (remote work at home job)
  • Computer with net access
  • It is critical that you be self-motivated and able to follow explicit instructions to start working from home
  • Self Motivated - you must be 100% able to commit to collaborating with little supervision
  • Work from home jobs of this nature need Web and one of the following: Laptop or PC, MAC, or Smart Device - Android or IOS
Ready to get going? Start today as well as earn money next week.

Thanks for checking us out and we look forward to helping you attain your goals!

title: title
description: description

title: Junior Digital Marketing Assistant
description:
Junior Digital Marketing Assistant

Are you looking for an opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of digital marketing? IMP is seeking a creative, energetic and detail-oriented Junior Digital Marketing Assistant to join our team. In this role, you will work with our team to develop and create creative designs for pay-per-click advertising, social media, email marketing and more using your graphic design and web development skills. There is also the opportunity to learn about campaign development and execution for these areas.

Come join a fun and knowledgeable team of digital marketing professionals in a flexible growth-driven work environment. Our existing team of 19 passionate experts loves working with our clients to help grow their business. Work with some of the most well-known hot tub and spa brands. Enjoy the benefits of a 6-hour workday, 12 days paid vacation right from the start, an extra paid day off for your birthday, a flexible remote work environment and a robust library of tools to define our team as the leading agency for the pool and hot tub industry. Read what our clients say about us and view our work.

Duties

  • Provide stellar support to Account Managers on projects and client retainer work
  • Creation and design of industry-leading emails
  • Dive into all digital assets for quality control and review
  • Assist with daily community management of client social media channels
  • Collaborate with team members to create remarkable graphic design pieces
  • Design unforgettable PPC ads for social media, google, display and connected TV campaigns
  • Become an officer of the brand to ensure all client and brand guidelines are followed
  • Participation in regular team meetings and collaboration sessions

Skills

  • Graphic design skills using Adobe Suite, Canva, Creatopy
  • 1+ years of experience working in B2C digital marketing
  • Functional knowledge of social media platforms
  • Email marketing design and deployment
  • Base knowledge/experience of Adobe Suite
  • Ability to stay organized and meet project deadlines
  • WordPress/Shopify dev experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Previous experience with SalesForce, SharpSpring or Accelo is an asset

Why Work Here?

An amazing culture with flexible hours and work from home. Enhance your skills by learning from your team and work on exciting client projects.

Please include graphic design work samples or portfolio with your application.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $40,000.00-$45,000.00 per year

title: Real Estate Assistant
description:
Position Requirements

This is an ideal opportunity to work with one of the top agents in Edmonton.

Previous experience in a Real Estate Assistant role or Real Estate Representative role is a MUST. Graduates of a recognized legal assistant/paralegal program will fit this role as well.

Excellent oral communication and writing skills; an artistic eye for the development of Real Estate Brochures, Ads and Property Descriptions

Strong computer skills (Word and Outlook); ability to adapt to new software systems. Social media and advertising media management experience

Exceptional interpersonal skills and professionalism; ability to act with tact and diplomacy

Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines. Good organizational and time management skills and the ability to prioritize and handle time sensitive projects effectively

A positive self-starter who can take initiative; require excellent attention to details

High integrity, ability to maintain confidentiality is essential

Reliable transportation and the ability to travel locally as required

This is a flexible/hybrid schedule which will require occasionally work outside normal office hours

Listing & Sales/Purchase Administration:

Responsible for preparing and drafting a variety of complex documents

Liaise with sales representatives, lawyers and financial institutions

Broker loading of listings, listings update management

Actively advance files with minimal instruction - conditions follow up, lawyer information, trade record details, vendor/buyer letters

Preparing write ups for new listings feature sheets and brochures

Advertising preparation and submission

Maintain and manage deadlines and online systems

Client Care Functions:

Provide high quality service to clients; making certain clients are kept informed throughout the process

Generating weekly reports with feedback summaries, number of showings for past week, number of web and video views

Assistance Preparing CMAs, Pre-List or Buyer Packages for appointments

Ensuring the accuracy and maintenance of the client database / files

Office Administration Functions:

Answering phone and email inquiries

Organizing and confirming showing requests for listings

Booking showings for buyers

Crafting communications on behalf of manager

Updating content for social media and website(s) management

Office procedures reference binders

Technology and systems administration functions

All other duties as may be assigned

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50,000.00-$55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Day shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Office is limited to maximum 3 personnel at any time.

Experience:

  • Real Estate related: 1 year (required)

Application deadline: 2022-05-07

title: Marketing Administrative Assistant
description:
You will be working in a team environment within our Marketing department. As a Marketing Administrative Assistant, you will be responsible for assisting with daily marketing activities and trade show preparation. Your functions will include but are not limited to:

  • Coordinating all tasks related to the execution of trade shows. This includes: arranging trade show space, confirming lighting, logistics, booking hotels and flights for all show attendees, and other related responsibilities.
  • Assisting the marketing team in preparing, setting up, and product planning for trade shows.
  • Working directly with management and members of the team to organize trade show product selection, showcases, planning, and logistics.
  • Ensuring all necessary product is collected and labelled for each trade show, which may include collecting items from our warehouse from time to time.
  • Attending trade shows to support the marketing and sales team when necessary.
  • Maintaining, organizing and updating all files related to trade shows.
  • Supporting the marketing team on project-based work in the development of marketing strategies.
  • Providing input, support and ideas to marketing initiatives and subsequently promoting those initiatives while monitoring results. This includes: promotions, email marketing campaigns, advertising, and trade shows.
  • Supporting the marketing team in conceptualizing and creating marketing materials for customer direct marketing, trade show promotional use or social media content.
  • Assisting with creating marketing materials. This includes: product descriptions, creative blurbs, email marketing and other marketing related materials.
  • Updating email lists on a weekly basis, sending email campaigns when needed, and managing any unsubscribes.
  • Maintaining and updating all marketing folders, spreadsheets, and copy for all packaging and ad material in the master spreadsheet.
  • Working on creative methods to promote the sale, and use, of our company products.
  • Supporting all social media accounts. This includes: collaborating with management to develop content and strategy, maintaining and updating all online platforms, updating spreadsheets, and monitoring results.
  • Creating high visual impact at trade shows, and in our in-house showroom.
  • Supporting our graphics and sales teams when samples, mock-ups or artwork proofing is required.
  • Supporting our sourcing department to test and use products from a quality control perspective to ensure products meet our high standards.

For the effective performance of your duties, you will be expected to possess the following qualities:

  • Quick learner with solid business instincts.
  • Ability to work well with others and be an effective communicator.
  • Exceptional computer skills in MS Office and Outlook.
  • Ability to problem solve and think critically.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize work accordingly.
  • Ability to begin, manage and finish multiple projects simultaneously and be extremely organized in order to meet tight deadlines.
  • Solid understanding of and ability to effectively utilize social media platforms such as Instagram and Facebook.
  • Proven ability to manage and organize a heavy flow of information.
  • Ability to work under pressure while maintaining a high level of attention to detail.
  • Ability to be self-motivated and work independently when required.

Prerequisites:

  • Post-Secondary education in an associated field.
  • 1+ years’ experience in a similar role.
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite would be an asset.

Additional information and benefits:

  • Travel may occasionally be required, to attend trade shows within North America.
  • May be required to lift boxes up to 20lbs.
  • 8 hour working days, Monday through Friday.
  • Working on site with our fun and diverse team.
  • Health and Dental benefits offered after 3 months.
  • Ten (10) paid personal days per year in addition to paid vacation days.
  • Salary increase and bonus in December 2022.
  • Company pension plan offered.
  • Salary: $48,000 to $52,000 annually.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $48,000.00-$52,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: newMarketing and Admin Assistant
description:
Marketing and Admin Assistant – Part to Full Time

Armada Mortgage Corporation (MIC) is an Independent Mortgage Lender, Investment Manager and Brokerage. We are located in a brand new, sunny, casual office building with a view, in Langley near the freeway and the Golden Ears Bridge with easy access. Our Company was founded in 1995, and we arrange 1st and 2nd mortgages, and distribute and manage the sales of Class ‘A’ Preferred shares to our shareholders. Please look us up www.armadamortgage.com

We are looking for an employee who is interested in working in the financial sector in a growing company and industry, and work in a collaborative team environment. This Industry role has a variety of tasks, making the position varying and interesting. This position is new without much daily structure, so being a self-starter who is interested in creating your own tasks will be fundamental. This position is work in office, with the opportunity for occasional work from home.

Job Description:

  • Design ads and infographics on Canva, Photoshop, and Illustrator
  • Create content for and Post on all Social media platforms
  • Create content for and help design a WordPress website, combining user interface and design
  • Use and incorporate on and off page SEO and similar methodologies
  • Other client outreach, such as contests, giveaways, and cards
  • Following up with warm leads
  • Research, develop concepts, and arrange marketing events such as home shows and tradeshows
  • Devise fundraising promotions and other advertising strategies
  • Receive and manage customer feedback and satisfaction
  • Admin Duties: answering and redirecting emails, answering phones, organizing staff events, file management, other misc. admin duties

Requirements:

  • Fluent English
  • Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Two years in Marketing education preferred
  • Experience in creating written and visual content
  • Knowledgeable in website design, familiarity with website coding preferred
  • Strong knowledge in social media platforms
  • Familiar with photoshop, illustrator, and Canva
  • Should be accurate and have good attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize
  • Ability to work independently, and choosing and directing your own projects

Benefits:

  • Business casual dress and environment, easy access to office via main roads
  • Health care
  • Work from Home Flexibility when needed
  • Monday to Friday schedule

32 hours a week (more hours available if interested), weekends and stat. Holidays closed

Please include Resume and Cover Letter

We look forward to hearing from you!

We appreciate all those that apply but only those shortlisted will be contacted.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 24-32 per week

Salary: $23.00-$26.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flextime
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

COVID-19 considerations:
All clients can be asked to wear masks, surfaces are regularly sanitized, clients are appointment only

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Langley, BC V1M 0B2: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Marketing: 1 year (preferred)
