title: Administrative Assistant
description:
SC Chemistry

Competition No. -
S104947793

Posting Date -
May 02, 2022

Closing Date -
May 09, 2022


Position Type -
Full Time - Operating Funded

Salary Range -
$46,627 to $62,954 per year

Grade -
07

Hours -
35


This competition is open to all applicants however internal candidates and applicants who were former employees of the University of Alberta in the past 18 months will be given priority consideration before external candidates. Please indicate your internal status using the "Advertisement" drop down menu when applying.


This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA).

This position offers a comprehensive benefits package which can be viewed at: Faculty & Staff Benefits.

Location - North campus

Working for the University of Alberta

The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Métis, Inuit and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community.

The University of Alberta is teeming with change makers, community builders, and world shapers who lead with purpose each and every day. We are home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs, over 13,000 faculty and staff, 260,000 alumni worldwide and have been recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers for over a decade.

Your work will have a meaningful influence on a fascinating cross section of people—from our students and stakeholders, to our renowned researchers and innovators who are quite literally curing diseases, making discoveries and generating solutions that make the world healthier, safer, stronger, and more just.

Department summary

The Department of Chemistry at the University of Alberta provides an outstanding environment for studies in chemistry, is among the most research active departments in Canada, and is regarded as being among the top three in the country. The department is one of the best equipped and best funded in North America and has a faculty renowned internationally for its excellence in teaching and research.

Position summary

The Department of Chemistry is seeking a customer-service focused administrator with excellent organization skills and superior attention to detail to fulfill the Administrative Assistant role. Under the supervision of the Academic Department Manager, this position is responsible for delivering a comprehensive set of administrative services to support the teaching and research programs of the Department.

Duties

  • Greets visitors and delivers exceptional customer service assistance while providing an overall welcoming environment
  • Responds to a variety of inquiries from visitors, students, and staff; evaluates incoming calls and emails, and responds or redirects as appropriate
  • Maintains and updates the Department’s website and social media accounts
  • Coordinates travel arrangements for faculty, staff, and students when traveling for business purposes, such as conferences or recruitment events
  • Coordinates the Department’s Visiting Speaker Program
    • Assists faculty and student groups with organizing visiting speaker program events, advertising, arranging travel and catering, scheduling site bookings, and other associated activities
    • Coordinates all aspects of meetings and speaking events; including creating agendas, tracking action items, obtaining venue, equipment, catering, coordinating with external service providers, sending out communications, etc.
  • Provides guidance and assistance to students, staff, and visitors for entering and submitting travel & expense claims; completes paper claims for non-employees as required
  • Assists researchers with the initiation and troubleshooting of purchase requisitions, purchase orders, and invoices through SupplyNet
  • Requests Corporate Credit Cards for faculty and staff through the Staff Service Centre as required
  • Performs credit card verifications and reconciliations for Departmental credit card and assists PIs with the reconciliation of their credit cards
  • Reviews individual financial transactions and supporting documentation for accuracy, appropriate authorizations, and compliance to institutional and granting agency policies
  • Provides guidance and assists Principle Investigators (PIs) with the initiation of routine financial transactions for their research grants and escalates issues to the Staff Service Centre or assigned Financial Partner
  • Identifies, troubleshoots, and corrects/resolves transactional issues, while escalating broader, more complex issues
  • Provides multi-dimensional support to the CFI-funded projects held under the Department
  • Maintains financial spreadsheets and/or databases for various Departmental programs
  • Runs standard reports, compiles and maintains data and assembles and formats data to create simple reports
  • Photocopies, prints, and collates documents for faculty members and instructors; submits orders to external printing services as required
  • Sorts and distributes mail and maintains mailroom equipment and supplies by adding new users, ordering supplies for photocopiers and fax machines; troubleshooting problems and submitting service equipment service requests as necessary
  • Manages the Department’s conference rooms, books meeting requests and/or provides booking assistance and oversight; accepts, alters, rejects, cancels, or holds booking requests via a dedicated email account

Qualifications

  • Minimum Business Administration Diploma preferred; equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered
  • Minimum of two years related office or administrative experience
  • Adaptable, agile and technologically savvy; advanced capability with MS Office suite, Google Applications and PeopleSoft systems
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills including strong ability to demonstrate professionalism, confidentiality, and diplomacy
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative and perform duties independently
  • Superior organization, accuracy, and attention to detail
  • Excellent spelling, grammar, editing, and proofreading skills
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, high volume environment
  • Strong business acumen to confidently work with multiple stakeholders
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills and critical thinking skills

How to Apply

Note: Online applications are accepted until midnight Mountain Standard Time of the closing date.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

The University of Alberta is committed to an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from all qualified persons. We encourage women; First Nations, Métis and Inuit persons; members of visible minority groups; persons with disabilities; persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity and expression; and all those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas and the University to apply.

COVID-19 Vaccination: Proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 in compliance with the University’s COVID-19 Vaccination Directive. Fully Vaccinated means a status an individual achieves 14 days after having received the recommended number of doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada or the World Health Organization, and requires the individual to maintain the recommended number and type of vaccine doses as updated and required by Health Canada thereafter.

title: Recruitment Assistant, PFT
description:
Description

Corporate Services Division


Invites applications for the position of:


Recruitment Assistant


Permanent Full Time

Start Date: As soon as possible

2022 Salary Grid 4: $29.34-$34.93

Location: Brockville, Ontario


Position Summary:


Reporting to the Human Resources Manager, the Recruitment Assistant is responsible for providing professional and efficient recruitment support to the Human Resources Department. Working closely with the HR team and hiring leaders, the Recruitment Assistant will support the strategic and proactive sourcing of skilled talent for opportunities throughout a diverse organization.


QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in business administration, human resources or other related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Minimum two years of experience in a human resources environment preferably in a unionized municipal or public sector setting.
  • Experience with the full recruitment cycle preferred.
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and Outlook), HRIS with UKG Pro experience an asset.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; both written and verbal
  • Demonstrated ability to respect the confidentiality of information
  • Demonstrated ability to provide guidance and advice to others
  • Self-motivated with ability to work independently within a collaborative team environment
  • Proven ability to consistently maintain high quality standards
  • Meticulous attention to detail and a strong degree of accuracy/reliability
  • Demonstrated a commitment to customer service
  • Strong organizational and time management skill
  • Ability to manage heavy workload/multiple tasks/meet tight deadlines
  • Solid grounding of human resources administrative principles, practices and techniques
  • Working knowledge of applicable employment legislation, human resources policies and procedures and collective agreements
  • Highly developed keyboarding skills and office practices and procedures

Summary of Position Responsibilities:


Activity 1: Recruitment Administration (approximately 70%)

  • Coordinate the recruitment process
  • Prepare recruitment file, job postings/advertising, screen resumes, arrange interviews, prepare interview packages and complete reference checks
  • Create compelling job postings and post on internal and external job boards and Counties website; recommend alternate appropriate channels or media
  • Track each job competition for its duration ensuring all administrative functions are accurately completed.
  • Respond to all inquiries regarding job competitions; internal and external.
  • Primary technical support to internal/external applicants
  • Act as a member of the recruitment selection team on an occasional basis.
  • Monitor and minimize time to hire as a key performance metric; prepare various reports and other statistical information as requested.
  • Act as main contact for unpaid placement students, working with the Departmental Manager to determine if there is a desire for placement students, and coordinating the recruitment process
  • Prepare documentation required for new hires, establish personnel file and prepare the announcement for newly hired employees.
  • Provide advice and support to management throughout the selection process.
  • Conduct and document reference checks as requested.
  • Recommend strategies for a variety of roles in difficult to fill labour markets.

Activity 2: Records Retention (approximately 20%)

  • Process various types of documentation while maintaining accuracy and integrity of information.
  • Maintain confidential employee and training records.
  • Update Human Resources section of both the internal (ECM) and External Counties’ website.

Activity 3: General (approximately 10%)

  • Prepare, coordinate, and lead ad hoc projects as the need arises or becomes apparent.
  • Participate and collaborate in recruitment initiatives.
  • Continuous assessment of processes and administrative efforts to improve/update them.
  • Under guidance from Consultant(s), respond to routine staff enquiries and provide accurate and reliable information within specified guidelines.
  • Provide coverage for absence within the HR Team as assigned.

Other related duties, as requested and required.


WORKING CONDITIONS:


  • Mostly inside work, working in an office environment.
  • Hours of work per week: 35 hours.
  • Work involves frequent interruptions to respond to demands.
  • Work outside of normal business hours to meet needs as required (minimal).
  • Infrequent overnight trips for training.

The foregoing Job Description reflects the general duties necessary to describe the principal functions of the job identified, and shall not be construed to be all of the work requirements that may be inherent in this classification.


Resumes should be marked “Competition # CS-22-072 Recruitment Assistant, PFT” and apply online by 4:00 p.m. on /before Thursday May 12, 2022 at 4:00 p.m. to: https://careers.leedsgrenville.com


Applicant information is collected under the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (MFIPPA), and will only be used for candidate selection.


The United Counties of Leeds and Grenville is committed to providing a recruitment and selection process that is both inclusive and free from barriers. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request, and will be provided in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.


Applicants are required, in advance, to make any accommodation request known to Human Resources by contacting the department at 1-800-770-2170 extension 2308 or using the Bell Relay Service. Human Resources will strive to provide reasonable and appropriate accommodation for all applicants, during the recruitment and selection process, which will ensure the process, is conducted in a fair and equitable manner.


Education College Diploma Experience 2 years

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT

Position Summary:

This is an opportunity to support the Executive Director with administrative support at Transition House. The Administrative Assistant will work flexible hours, many from a home office, for a total of 35 hours a week. The Administrative Assistant will support the mission of Transition House and work in collaboration with other organizational staff as required.

Skills and Knowledge Required:

  • Previous experience within a team-based environment supported by a post-secondary certificate in administration and/or finance
  • Ability to be flexible with some work from home and the office as required
  • Excellent computer literacy and familiarity with standard MS Office programs and data spreadsheets, specifically Excel.
  • Ability to book virtual meetings, take minutes and manage distribution lists
  • Ability to support communication and in partnership with a variety of community agencies that serve the needs of Transition House clients
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral
  • Good time management, problem-solving and assessment skills
  • Clear police check (vulnerable sector), renewed annually.

Summary of Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Attend all meetings of the Executive Director and prepare distribute minutes
  • Collect and manage all documentation associated with billing and invoicing including allocations
  • Work with the accounting department to ensure monthly reconciliations of accounts
  • Responsible to ensure regular banking transactions including deposits
  • Participates in program and agency meetings and relevant training
  • Support communications with branding for all external documents
  • Maintains individual records that follow organizational filing system
  • Creation of advertising materials for distribution related to fundraising

Transition House is an emergency shelter. www.thshelter.ca In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), Transition House will provide accommodation in all parts of the hiring process as required, upon request from applicants.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Employee assistance program
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • MS Excel: 1 year (preferred)
  • Database administration: 1 year (preferred)

title: Assistant Marketing Manager
description:
American Express invites you to share your resume so you can be considered for a future Marketing, Product & Project Management Roles based in Canada.

Find your place on #TeamAmex

Consistently ranked as one of the world’s most valuable brands, American Express is a globally integrated payments company that provides more than 112 million business and consumer Card Members with access to products, insights and experiences that enrich lives and build business success. With offices in Toronto, New York, London, Sydney and more, we operate in 110 countries to provide the world’s best customer experience every day.

Our Consumer Services team, responsible for issuing a wide range of consumer card and lending products across Canada, is hiring assistant marketing, product and project managers. You lead the way by shaping strategies, executing campaigns and collaborating across the enterprise to become essential to our customers; we’ll have your back by prioritizing well-being, fostering an inclusive culture, and supporting and rewarding your personal and professional growth every step of the way.

What we’re looking for:

Our customers expect the best – and we are proud to deliver it.

As marketers at one of the most iconic brands in the world, you play a major role in building authentic relationships with customers who impact life and business around the world. Here, creativity and inspired storytelling meet powerful data-based marketing and personalized digital communication to drive business results. You will build exceptional cross-functional relationships and learn the foundational elements of marketing while nurturing a broad set of skills including strategic thinking, analytics, communication, problem solving, and leadership.

American Express invites you to share your resume for future opportunities in Toronto across many dynamic functions including Consumer Products, New Product Development, Lending, Acquisition, Project Management, Insurance, Loyalty & Benefits, Partnerships, Brand & Advertising and more!

The experience we offer:

  • Lead exciting projects and own initiatives to acquire, engage and deliver meaning experiences for millions of Canadians.
  • Launch new products, offers and campaigns with a ‘speed-to-market’ focus from strategic planning, customer segmentation, beta testing to live in-market delivery.
  • Collaborate with a dynamic and progressive team that responds to a constantly changing landscape with proven strategies and market-leading innovation.
  • Showcase your superior communication, influencing and collaboration skills with internal and external partners.
  • Grow and develop both personally and professionally through formal development planning and mentorship sessions.
  • Build on an inclusive culture and have fun along the way!

If this sounds like you, please apply!


  • Bachelor’s degree or fabulous on-the job experience
  • Highly motivated self-starter – you think strategically and execute flawlessly.
  • Terrific team player – you build strong relationships to champion ideas, initiatives, and projects across internal cross-functional and external stakeholders.
  • Excellent communicator – you’re reliable, accountable and you bring others along.
  • Results driver – you demonstrate a high degree of personal excellence.
  • Growth mindset – you’re willing to learn, ask questions and get creative.
  • Insights-driven – you gather and articulate the ‘so what’ by deriving insights from analytics to solve meaningful problems.
  • Culture leader – you help build an inclusive culture where everyone belongs.
  • And, of course, passion for marketing, payments and innovation!

Some of our awesome benefits

  • Daily well-being sessions
  • Weekly meditation sessions
  • Healthy Minds counselling for you and your household
  • Tuition subsidies for courses
  • Employee Stock Ownership Program
  • Flexible health benefits plan
  • Annual Fitness Credit

American Express is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible work environment in which all people who apply for positions or who work for or on behalf of Amex are treated with dignity and respect and are provided with equal treatment with respect to employment, regardless of that person’s age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, race, colour, ancestry, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, religion or creed, marital status, family status, pregnancy, disability, record of offences, social condition or origin, political beliefs, association or activity or other factors prohibited under applicable Human Rights legislation (the “Prohibited Grounds”). If you have a disability and need accommodation, please speak with the Recruiter for more information.

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

**Please note that this is a general job posting. You may not receive a timely response from us on the status of your application**

title: Executive Assistant - GDA
description:
What We Offer


At GDA, you can build a career out of making things happen! GDA Capital is a fast growing organization that provides vertically integrated financial technology services to institutional investors and disruptive technology companies. We are the trusted advisor that bridges the gap between the institutional capital market and disruptive technologies. This is an exciting time to join our growing team.


We have an interesting opportunity for a talented Executive Assistant to join our company. This role will be responsible for supporting the Founders with growth potential within the organization. This role will primarily keep the calendar and travel arrangements up to date, prepare presentations, and coordinate meetings. This role would be ideally suited to a tech-savvy individual able to self-manage, available to travel and work independently and remotely, set priorities and efficiently manage day to day processes with a high degree of detail, accuracy, and organization.


Responsibilities & Expectations


Based out of our downtown Toronto office, the main responsibilities and expectations for the role are:


Key Responsibilities:


  • Provide daily administrative and coordination support to the SVP, International Banking and the SVP of Sales & Trading
  • Coordinate meetings, presentations and customer visits
  • Prepare presentations when required
  • Book travel and accommodation
  • Keep track of necessary reports and updates
  • Respond and filter inquiries
  • Participate in business trips

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience in a related role
  • Experience in a startup environment preferred
  • Strong organization and time manage skills
  • Adaptable and able to prioritize
  • Highly skilled in learning on the job and continuously learning
  • Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
  • Mature, professional, driven, empathetic
  • Available to travel


What You Will Gain from Joining our Team:

  • Joining a growth focused, exciting team culture
  • A chance to make a difference in a growing company
  • Exciting projects and an opportunity to shape our future
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package
  • Flexibility
  • A focus and support on professional development - we value ongoing learning

Compensation


We offer competitive compensation and benefits and are committed to seeing our employees succeed.


Why Global Digital Assets (GDA) ?

GDA is one of the fastest growing boutique digital financial technology firms in Canada. The level of growth that is expected in the coming years is staggering, and we need the right person to come on board to help support this growth.


The number one quality we value is teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting long term career possibilities are available for the driven energetic leader that joins us. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


Joining GDA today means joining a team of ambitious and caring individuals. Become a key part of our growth by applying today.


Please note, GDA Capital receives a high volume of applicants thus only those selected to move forward in our interview process will be contacted.


GDA is an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We enthusiastically accept our responsibility to make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, colour, age, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, religion, marital status, disability, military service or veteran status, genetic information, medical condition including medical characteristics, or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state, and local laws and ordinances. Our management is dedicated to ensuring the fulfillment of this policy with respect to hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, termination, recruitment advertising, pay, and other forms of compensation, training, and general treatment during employment.

Show more

title: Research Assistant
description:
Department: Marketing Management, Ted Rogers School of Management
Position supervisor: Dr. Mathieu Lajante
Contract length: A week
Hours of work per week: 5 hours
Position type: Research Assistant
Rate of pay: $19.22/hr

About Ryerson

At the intersection of mind and action, Ryerson is on a transformative path to become Canada’s leading comprehensive innovation university. Integral to this path is the placement of equity, diversity and inclusion as fundamental to our institutional culture. Our current academic plan outlines each as core values and we work to embed them in all that we do.

Ryerson University welcomes those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion and will assist us to expand our capacity for diversity in the broadest sense. In addition, to correct the conditions of disadvantage in employment in Canada, we encourage applications from members of groups that have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including First Nations, Metis and Inuit peoples, Indigenous peoples of North America, racialized persons, persons with disabilities, and those who identify as women and/or 2SLGBTQ+. Please note that all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, applications from Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

As an employer, we are working towards a people first culture and are proud to have been selected as one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers and a Greater Toronto’s Top Employer for 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018. To learn more about our work environment, colleagues, leaders, students and innovative educational environment, visit www.ryerson.ca, check out @RyersonU, external link, @RyersonHR, external link and @RyersonEC, external linkI on Twitter, and visit our LinkedIn company page, external link.
About the program/department/team
Dr Lajante devoted his PhD research to disentangle the concepts of aesthetic and utilitarian emotion for social (threatening tobacco warnings) and commercial (TV advertising) marketing communication effectiveness by means of neuroscience methods. He developed a strong expertise in psychophysiology and neuroscience and now, he developed a research program called “The firm’s empathic capacity” that aims at studying firm-customer emotional connectedness throughout technology-infused customer journey. Dr Lajante addresses the “missing middle” in interface technologies that serve as the medium in firm-customer interaction and he strives to understand the role of empathy in a technology-infused omni-channel customer journey, and to determine what combinations of human (touch) and machine (tech) functions are most effective in retailing and consumer services.

He has published in several marketing journals, which include Journal of Retailing and Consumer Services, Journal of Consumer Marketing, Journal of Advertising Research, Journal of Neuroscience, Psychology and Economics, and Frontiers in Psychology.
The opportunity
Under the hierarchical authority of Mathieu Lajante, associate professor at the Ted Rogers School of Management and researcher in the marketing department, the research assistant will design an experimental website article (text+pictures) to be used in an online experiment.
Qualifications
Bachelor students, MSc students, or PhD students. Creative skills; seasoned web designer.
How to apply
Click 'Apply' to be directed to the Ryerson Careers page for further instructions on how to apply online. Please email your application to Mathieu Lajante. Applications should be submitted in PDF or Word formats. In the subject line please indicate: “RA position”.

Applications should include: CV, letter of application and reference contacts

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only candidates who are invited to an interview will be contacted.
Ryerson’s commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion
We encourage all First Nations, Metis and Inuit peoples or Indigenous peoples of North America, to self-identify in their applications and also reach out to Tracey King, Indigenous Human Resources Lead for support during the selection process.

Ryerson University is committed to the principles of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and aims to ensure that independence, dignity, integration and equality of opportunity are embedded in all aspects of the university culture.

We will provide an accessible experience for applicants, students, employees, and members of the Ryerson community. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, beginning with the recruitment process. If you have restrictions that need to be accommodated to fully participate in any phase of the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

Please watch a message from Ryerson's Vice President, Equity and Community Inclusion for more information on our commitment to equity.

Important Notice Re: Job Postings during COVID-19
Following the advice of government and health authorities to slow the spread of COVID-19, all employees have been equipped to work from home until further notice. New employees will also work from home with the exception of those who have been deemed 'essential' and are required to be on campus. All recruiting activities including interviews and onboarding are being conducted virtually.

To protect the health and safety of community members on campus and to comply with the recommendations from public health authorities and requirements of the provincial government, Ryerson, like other post-secondary institutions in Ontario, will require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit proof of vaccination.

Job Types: Part-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 1 week
Part-time hours: 5 per week

Salary: $19.22 per hour

Show more

title: Communications Assistant
description:
Communications Assistant

4Korners is a registered Canadian charitable organization founded in 2005. We connect individuals of the Laurentians with programs and services to meet their identified needs in a secure and inclusive environment. We work collectively to serve and enrich the lives of communities in the Laurentian region.

Summary

4Korners is looking for a professional and creative Communications Assistant to join our team. You’ll be responsible for managing all 4Korners social media accounts as well as various other communications projects and materials.

The ideal candidate must be an excellent communicator with strong attention to detail. Ultimately, the primary objective will be to ensure clear communication of the organization’s message across multiple channels.

Key Responsibilities

Under the supervision of the Executive and Assistant Directors, and in collaboration with the team, volunteers, interns, and community partners; the Communications Assistant will report directly to the Assistant Director.

The Communications Assistant will fulfill the duties as outlined below:

  • Schedule and publish engaging posts/stories/content on Facebook, Instagram, Tiktok, Linkedin

(photos, videos, articles) Must understand how to communicate with various audiences(Seniors, Teens, Families).

  • Respond to social media comments, inbox messages and requests.
  • Manage YouTube account, support live event broadcasts and link to various other social media platforms.
  • Plan and distribute 4Korners monthly e-bulletin (Mailchimp)
  • Draft and edit communications copy and material (press releases, articles for local papers, etc..)
  • Write press releases and various short (English-language) articles for local papers.
  • Develop and update distribution lists that are essential to the organization (media, clients, organizations, public, etc.)
  • Monitor and implement Google Ad Grants advertising.
  • Ensure Google page for business is up to date.
  • Present and promote the organization at various external events
  • Stay apprised of digital media trends and developments.
  • Create simple graphics and photo edits.
  • Work as an integral part of the organization’s team (monthly reports, team meetings and committee work).
  • Other communications related tasks as requested.

Qualifications & Experience

  • Proficient in various social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube)
  • Knowledge of media relations and digital media strategies
  • Proficient in the following; MS Office, Google Workspace, Google Analytics, Google Ad Grants,

Mailchimp and Asana (an asset)

  • Working knowledge of design software (e.g., Photoshop, InDesign)
  • Outstanding communication skills in English (oral and written)
  • Video recording and editing skills
  • Autonomous and able to make decisions when appropriate
  • Strong organizational skills and detail oriented
  • High degree of resourcefulness, and adaptability
  • Able to work in close collaboration with a team

Start date: As soon as possible.

Compensation: $19.80 - $24.80

Language(s) of work: Both official languages. English and French

Hours of Work & Contract Timeline: 20 hrs/week, Monday to Friday

Location: Remote

4Korners provides its employees with a Health Insurance program and extra paid vacation during the

December holiday season.

How to apply

Please email your CV and cover letter stating your experience and outlining your ability to coordinate this project to the email provided in this advertisement.

We appreciate the time and energy candidates put into this process, however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted. This position will stay open until filled by the best candidate.

4Korners is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce, encouraging applications from all qualified individuals. We strongly encourage applications from members of the

Government of Canada’s job equity groups (i.e., persons with disabilities, Aboriginal peoples, and newcomers to Canada), and from all groups who experience marginalization. We encourage applicants to self-identify in their cover letter if they are comfortable doing so. Due to the nature of our work traditionally being women led, and to contribute to gender equality in the workforce, we also encourage men to apply.

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 20 per week

Salary: $19.80-$24.80 per hour

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
All customers are required to wear a mask.

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

title: Amazon Advertising Assistant (PPC) Manager
description:
Hey there. We’re Outgive!

If you’re reading this, chances are you’re either looking for a new job, someone thought of you and sent you this link, or you saw something here that drew your interest. Regardless of how you get here, we hope you’re as excited about this role as we are excited to meet you!

Let’s break down the FAQs of this job ad to help you decide if this is the right opportunity for you.

What does Outgive do?
Outgive is the parent organization of several different powerhouse brands and companies. All of them have one thing in common, and that is e-commerce! We are a fast-growing company at the intersection of technology and digital marketing. This role is under our digital marketing agency, Seller Interactive.

Seller Interactive is the largest and fastest-growing Amazon FBA Marketing Agency based in Canada, with clients worldwide. We partner with Brand Owners that are looking to scale their e-commerce business on Amazon by providing full account management that includes: Listing Optimizations, Advertising, Customer Service, and Account Health Support.

How do brands find us? Just google us! Seller Interactive is ranked #1 for “Amazon Product Launch” and #2 for “Amazon Marketing Agency”

With humble beginnings in Toronto, Outgive was established in 2013 by two friends and has grown to become a global team of 350+ specialized experts. We take pride in being more than just a place of employment, but by creating environments where anyone can bring their whole selves to work. As Outgivers, we share a passion for the e-commerce and digital industry, supporting collaboration and diversity, and finding innovative ways to carve success for our clients and ourselves.

Where can I find more information about Outgive and what it’s like working there?
Visit our website at www.outgive.ca to check out our complete family of companies, or visit us on social media @outgiveinc to learn more!

What’s awesome about being an Outgiver?
Our company isn’t just about profits. It’s built around the community. We want you to enjoy doing what you do best, and we promise to give you the autonomy and support to do it in a way that works for everyone - our customers and clients, the company, and most importantly, you. Some of the benefits we offer include:
  • Flexible work schedule. Never have the feeling of being late again!
  • Unlimited paid time off. Want a few extra vacation days for your overseas trip? No problem. Need to extend your weekend staycation? Just let us know!
  • Birthday and work anniversary celebrations. We love to celebrate you! We’ll gift you gift cards or dinner for these special occasions. We promise not to make you awkwardly stand there while we sing “happy birthday” to you.
  • Remote work options are available. Work where you work best (though this may vary on the type of role and responsibilities). Many of our team members are working from home 80-90% of the year (permanent work-from-home opportunities available).
  • Drop-And-Go Offices are available. Prefer a change of scenery or tired of hearing your roommate's daily 9 am Zoom calls? We have frequently sanitized, recently renovated, and pet-friendly offices in the GTA! Casual dress code in effect and come and go as you please!
  • Free healthy snacks. Just let us know what snacks or coffee/tea keep you fueled, and we’ll stock them for the kitchen.
  • Office gym. Eat too many of those snacks? Our employee-only office gym at our head office in Mississauga is available for you 24/7. It’s no Globo gym but it’ll do!
  • Paid time off to volunteer. Are you involved in a local non-profit or do you enjoy pro-bono consulting? Outgivers get paid time off to give back to the community.
  • Recognition programs. Convert your daily or weekly peer-to-peer brownie points for gift cards, trips, food, and more!

What’s the job?
We are looking for an Amazon Advertising Assistant (PPC) Manager to join our growing team. This position will be a visible leadership position within the organization, allowing you to flex your creative and strategic muscles on a daily basis! Reporting directly to the Head of Amazon Advertising, you’ll be able to learn more about Amazon advertising and support the growth of the company.
  • Own communication with clients: whether that be a warm zoom call, articulate email, or beautifully crafted deck.
  • Collaborate with Account Managers to strategize and grow high value accounts.
  • Collaborate with PPC specialist to setup campaigns, grow accounts and prepare proposals/strategies.
  • Analyze campaign performance, compare current campaign execution strategies with new ideas to test and iterate to find incremental improvements.
  • Clearly understand and translate the needs of an advertiser into a strategic plan created for their performance goals.
  • Pull reports and prepare meaningful insights and recommendations.
  • Win trust of clients by progressively moving them up the advertising funnel.
  • Continuously support the development and improvement of our operational processes to drive efficiency.
  • Become a thought leader and trusted expert on the Amazon DSP!
We will provide you with new learning opportunities, the ability to execute your own creative ideas, and continuous professional development for your career.

Is it remote?
Cubicles are so 2018. We’re all about letting you work where you work best. We are 100% supportive of remote or hybrid work if that’s what you prefer. Let’s chat more about how we can create the best working environment for you.

What’s the pay?
Starting at $40,000 to $45,000 (depending on experience) with a big emphasis on “starting”! We’re hoping to continuously grow your skills, this role, and the salary that comes with it!

Am I qualified for the position?
We don’t believe in a strict list of “qualifications”. We care more about the passion for the industry and role, the grit you have to learn new challenges, and your ability to work well with others who you can learn from! Here are some general guidelines of what we’re looking for:
  • You love the Amazon marketplace and have a basic to intermediate level of knowledge when it comes to Amazon advertising, selling, optimization, and/or paid ads.
  • You thrive under pressure and tight timelines, with an ability to shift priorities based on client or business needs
  • You have experience with servicing clients on their PPC, with an ability to present ideas, data, results, and other findings to various stakeholders.
  • You’re looking for the next chapter of your career and want to be challenged in a fun and supportive environment!
  • Exhibit our 4 core values. Our 4Gs – grit, growth, gratitude, and greatness – are what drives us all to keep growing and learning as Outgivers.

Bonus points:
  • A genuine passion for e-commerce, advertisement, and/or marketing.
  • At least 1-year of experience working with various clients on their Amazon PPC.
  • Leadership or management experience.
Will I be able to succeed in this role?
Take a moment to ask yourself if you embody some, if not all, of our 4Gs - grit, growth, gratitude, greatness. If you think you have a driven personality combined with an appreciation for collaboration, teamwork, and creative freedom, then you definitely belong here!

How do I apply?
If you got this far, we hope you’re as excited about this opportunity as we are excited to meet you! Apply on our internal applicant tracking portal today ->https://outgive.applytojobs.ca/ppc/12516



About Outgive:

Outgive is the parent organization of several different brands and companies. All of them have one thing in common, and that is e-commerce! We are a fast-growing company at the intersection of technology and digital marketing. With humble beginnings in Toronto, Outgive was established in 2013 by two friends and has grown to become a global team of 350+ specialized experts. As Outgivers, we share a passion for the e-commerce and digital industry, supporting collaboration and diversity, and finding innovative ways to carve success for our clients and ourselves. Our company values consist of 4Gs - Grit, Growth, Greatness, and Gratitude. These are the values that drive all of us here to keep growing and learning.

Show more

title: Departmental Assistant (Human Resources)
description:
Departmental Assistant (Human Resources)

About Queen's University

Queen’s University is the Canadian research intensive university with a transformative student learning experience. Here the employment experience is as diverse as it is interesting. We have opportunities in multiple areas of globally recognized research, faculty administration, engineering & construction, athletics & recreation, power generation, corporate shared services, and many more.

We are committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcome applications from individuals from equity seeking groups such as women, racialized/visible minorities, Indigenous/Aboriginal peoples, persons with a disability, persons who identify in the LGBTQ+ community and others who reflect the diversity of Canadian society.

Come work with us!




Job Summary
Committed to equity, diversity and inclusion, and in collaborative team environment, the Departmental Assistant provides administrative support to the Central Human Resources (HR) Department. Working to high standards of courtesy, efficiency, service and security, the Departmental Assistant contributes to the smooth and efficient operation of both the Pension and Client Service Teams.

Reporting to the departmental Director, the Departmental Assistant will work in a busy office environment, providing administrative support to the Pension Services department and recruitment support within the Client Services team. Some functions of this role include booking meetings, recruitment advertising, triaging and responding to emails and inquires, updating and processing of HR forms, general duties, and file processing. As a part of the administrative support team, the Departmental Assistant provides back-up support to other HR units.

In addition, the Departmental Assistant will be required to function with an exceptional level of discretion, accuracy, good judgment, and efficiency.

Job Description
Administrative Support:
  • Provides administrative support to various units within Central HR.

  • First point of contact to visitors to the Pension Services team; responds in a timely manner to all incoming inquiries and requests received in person, by phone, email or fax; deals with routine requests and triages more complex requests as appropriate.

  • Provides general departmental clerical and administrative support services including word processing and proof reading; assists with preparation and distribution of correspondence and performs data entry functions.

  • Enters and verifies the completion of pension beneficiary forms.

  • Fulfills other related duties including receiving and directing mail, facilitating the courier process.


    • Recruitment Support:
  • Under the guidance of the Manager, Talent Acquisition, place job advertisements on various job posting sites.

  • Schedule interviews in support of the Queen’s Administrative Casual pool as needed.


    • Central Filing Process:
  • Create and process retiree/survivor/employee files and stores hard copy data appropriately.

  • Performs the file retention process in accordance with the Record Keeping Act and Freedom of Information and Protection Act (FiPPA) by following appropriate records retention schedules set by the Records Management and Privacy Office, ensuring that those actions are properly documented.

  • Coordinate with a third-party vendor for offsite storage.

  • Performs other duties as assigned to support the operational requirements of the Department.


    • REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Minimum of one year of post-secondary training in business administration practices

  • Minimum of one year experience providing administrative support to a department, organization, or office.

  • Demonstrated ability to effectively use Microsoft Office Suite (specifically Excel and Word)

  • Human Resources Certificate would be considered an asset

  • Consideration maybe given to candidates with the equivalent combination of education and experience.


    • SPECIAL SKILLS:
  • Welcoming and approachable demeanor combined with strong interpersonal and communications skills to deal effectively and enthusiastically with a wide variety of individuals and to provide clear and accurate information.

  • Effective communication skills (verbal & written) with the ability to adapt communication methods and strategies to suit diverse groups of individuals and circumstances.

  • Ability to adhere to strict confidentiality.

  • Ability to use discretion and good judgment in dealing with sensitive or confidential information, including the ability to discern when sensitive issues should be referred to the Team Lead.

  • Attention to detail is a key competency needed to ensure that communications and other materials are accurate and completed with accuracy.

  • Strong commitment to the provision of exceptional service and the value of diversity.

  • Effective organizational and time-management skills.

  • Problem-solving skills with an ability to know when to refer problems to others.

  • Knowledge and understanding of human resources policies, particularly as they relate to employment and training.


    • DECISION MAKING:
  • Determine how to prioritize work and time effectively to meet the competing demands during the day.

  • Determine formatting for documents.


    • Employment Equity and Accessibility Statement

    The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Queen’s is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal Peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. In accordance with Canadian Immigration requirements, priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents.

    The University provides support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, including accommodation that takes into account an applicant's accessibility needs. Candidates requiring accommodation during the recruitment process are asked to contact Human Resources at hradmin@queensu.ca.






    Skills
    • Calendar Management
    • Data Entry
    • Filing
    • Reception
    • Attention To Detail
    • Communications
    • Confidential Information Management
    • Human Resources
    • Interpersonal Skills



    Reference
    263319

title: Real Estate Assistant
description:
We are a growing Real Estate Team seeking individuals that fit our fun and professional culture. We are dedicated to growth through education, training and adapting technology to help us provide exceptional service to our clients. It is important to us to continue to build a brand that excites us and improves the lives of our clients, co-workers and our community.

We are seeking a Real Estate Assistant to join our growing team! Our commitment to providing the highest level of customer service has allowed us to build a thriving repeat and referral business. If you are passionate about creating the ultimate client care experience, are organized, professional, and relish in providing excellent customer service in an environment that encourages autonomy, initiative and idea-sharing - this may be the right fit for you! Applicants should be decisive, thorough, pay high attention to detail, and are excellent communicators. Interpersonal skills is a must! Ready to join the team? Start your application today!

Job description

Responsibilities:

  • CRM Management – updates, manage data, distribute daily prospecting and past client follow-up lists
  • Client appreciation event coordination and execution
  • Proactive client care, including client follow-up such as data and document collection, showings report, closing details
  • Responsible for coordinating activities related to listings activation and listing maintenance including, but not limited to: ordering signs and lockboxes
  • All administration of listings and purchases – including loading transaction details and collecting all required documentation
  • Email Marketing
  • Marketing coordination including: Newsletters, Emails, Ongoing contact with past clients: Flyers/Just Listed/Just Sold, Website updates, Calendars, Gifts and promotions, Advertising

Qualifications:

  • Exceptional communication and customer service skills, including excellent telephone manner
  • High level of initiative and the ability to multi-task
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Strong time management capabilities
  • Accurate data entry and reporting skills
  • Ability to work very well under pressure
  • Marketing knowledge is considered an asset
  • Basic Graphic Design knowledge is an asset.
  • Keen eye for graphic design/design in general
  • Must be comfortable navigating a computer/apps and software
  • Minimum high school education, with a preference to college level courses/ diploma
  • Access to your own vehicle is a must.

Experience:

  • administrative real estate (preferred)
  • TRREB / MLS (preferred)

HOURS:

30 Hours Per Week (+ bonus pay), Monday to Friday. Need to be mobile and in the Toronto/GTA area.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $20.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • customer service role: 2 years (preferred)

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
The Workforce Development Board (WDB) is a not-for-profit organization funded by the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development. Under the Canada Summer Jobs Program, we are seeking a motivated and dynamic individual with some marketing experience to work for us for 8 weeks this summer. The work week will be 35 hours, five days a week, at $16/hour with a start date of May 16, 2022, if possible. The Marketing Assistant will work remotely.

The Marketing Assistant will work closely with the Community Development and Communications Coordinator to assist in a wide range of activities covering all areas of marketing including (but not limited to):

· Producing and proofreading marketing and communications materials such as writing social posts, creating content for WDB’s monthly newsletter and Eventbrite events;

· Providing coordination and support to the Community Development and Communications Coordinator on marketing or communications-related projects;

· Assisting with analyses, development and implementation of communication and promotion strategies and information programs;

· Assisting with market research to determine awareness / advertising needs and developing appropriate marketing plans for related activities, initiatives and virtual events;

· Monitoring WDB’s social media / internet presence;

· Following direction to complete other tasks and projects as required.

This is an ideal role for a college or university student in business administration or communications to gain on-the-job experience and mentorship opportunities with an interest in working in a virtual team environment with a variety of stakeholders in the communities of Peterborough, City of Kawartha Lakes, Northumberland and Haliburton.

What You Will Bring:

· Experience with social media and related software such as Canva, Adobe Creative Suite and WordPress is considered an asset.

· Post-secondary focus on marketing, business administration, communications, or journalism considered an asset.

· High proficiency in all Microsoft Office programs, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

· Strong verbal and written communication skills.

· Ability to work independently to achieve day-to-day results.

· Evidence of exceptional interpersonal and stakeholder engagement skills.

· Demonstrated time management and organizational skills.

Qualified applicants are invited to send a cover letter and resume by May 9, 2022 at 4:00 p.m. indicating the position name in the Subject Line. As this position is funded under Canada Summer Jobs, please refer to the youth participant eligibility requirements https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/services/funding/canada-summer-jobs/screening-eligibility.html.

All Applications treated confidentially. While we appreciate all applications, we can only contact those individuals selected for interview.

We are committed to providing accommodation for persons with disabilities. Accommodation will be provided as part of our hiring process (if accommodation is required, Applicants are requested to make their needs known in advance).

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 8 weeks

Salary: $16.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-05-09
Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
Celebright is looking for an experienced Marketing Assistant to help grow our footprint across North America. Based in Kanata, Celebright designs, manufactures and installs permanent holiday lighting systems. The Marketing Assistant will help facilitate marketing initiatives to grow the Celebright brand, both locally and internationally.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Help Create marketing strategies and test campaigns for use in both Ottawa and throughout our North American dealer network
  • Manage social media platforms and leverage them to grow our brand
  • Gather, analyze and report analytics and marketing data
  • Perform market research and apply findings to future marketing campaigns.
  • Assist sales staff in dealer acquisition and support.
  • Work with both new and existing dealers to create and implement marketing strategies and offer support.
  • Collaborate closely with other departments such as sales, dealer network, and production.

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Direct marketing
  • Market research & segmentation
  • Project planning & coordination
  • Reporting research results
  • Strong computer skills
  • Basic graphic design skills an asset
  • Excellent proofing and editing abilities
  • Ability to multi-task and be highly organized at the same time
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Courteous and just generally nice to be around

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or a related field
  • Proven working experience in digital marketing
  • Demonstrable experience leading and managing SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media and advertising campaigns
  • Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform, and motivate
  • Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
  • Solid knowledge of website and marketing analytics tools
  • Working knowledge of ad serving tools
  • Strong social media knowledge using social media platforms, posting and engaging with customers

Compensation:

  • Salary to be negotiated based on successful applicant's skill set and experience
  • Bonus: annual bonus for company profit sharing
  • Benefits: Health, Dental, Vision + Life Insurance

Location:

  • Hybrid position with part time in office and part work from home.
  • Office is located in Kanata

About Celebright:
Celebright is a Fast Growing, Ottawa based company. We design permanent holiday lighting systems, which combine custom lighting controller hardware with industry leading cloud based control. We’re a tight knit group of nice people, with a focus on creating quality products and delivering an excellent customer experience.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Rollins Machinery, a lower mainland-based equipment company, is currently looking for a motivated individual to fill the position of Administrative Assistant - based out of our Agriculture Office in Chilliwack BC.

Job Summary

Rollins is currently looking for an Administrative Assistant to assist with an active Equipment shop consisting of Sales, Service and Parts. Working closely with the Branch Manager, the Administrative Assistant will assist with the day-to-day Chilliwack store operations;

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Daily Mail - Use postage machine
  • Visa/M/C/Debit Reporting - POS Machine
  • Banking Deposits
  • Accounts Payable - coding & posting
  • Stationery - Keep stock & order for office
  • Order equipment brochures when required
  • Maintain Sales Brochure & Operating Manual filing
  • Monthly equipment advertising updates
  • Assist customers with invoice copies & receivables questions
  • Balance M/C statements for Sales/Service & Parts
  • Monthly rental invoicing
  • Process Petty Cash reports and maintain balance in office
  • Supply & Set Up Stock #'s for three locations
  • Set up Account #'s for new Customers
  • Set up Sales Invoices for three locations
  • Review and close Sales & Contract invoices when completed. Working with acting dept. in Head Office for settling
  • Keep updated on GST/PST info
  • Supply PO#’s for Sales
  • Order & set up Stock Tags for equipment in yard
  • Maintain & trouble shoot Alarm if required
  • Set up and process Border Crossing & Equipment Transfers with brokers
  • Contact New Holland for Certificates of Origin
  • Process & submit warranty documents for various whole goods (New Holland, Pottinger, Supreme)
  • Process & submit New Holland contracts
  • Assist branch with IT repairs for computers
  • Assist with everyday issues - flowers/travel arrangements/processing holiday closure dates/gift certificates for promotions etc.

Required Education, Skills and Qualifications:

  • High School graduate
  • Positive and professional communication with customers and team members
  • Excellent attention to detail and a positive attitude, with good interpersonal skills
  • Excellent general computer skills and experience with Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel)
  • Superb customer service skills and strong organizational skills
  • Ability to work in a close team environment

If you thrive in a busy environment, have a positive attitude and strong customer service skills, have an excellent command of the English language both spoken and written, are detail and process oriented and are adept at multitasking and time management then we would like to hear from you. Experience is a definite asset, but we are willing to train the right candidate.

Company Profile

Rollins is privately held and been in business since 1946. We are a multi-industry, multi-line dealer selling equipment to Municipalities, Farms, Golf courses, and Private contractors in markets that include Refuse, Sewer & Water, Roads Maintenance, Sports Turf, and Agriculture. Rollins is continually looking to expand on our local footprint here in BC. We recently added the Kelowna branch to complement our existing locations in Langley, Chilliwack and Chemainus.

Join Our Team

Rollins provides a competitive salary and an attractive benefits package.

Resume and cover letter required.

NO PHONE CALLS please. Only parties of interest will be contacted.

Please visit our website at www.rollinsmachinery.com to learn more about us.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: Real Estate Assistant
description:
We are looking for a positive, hardworking, passionate individual who has preferably 1-year experience as a real estate admin assistant to support a busy real estate agent.

Job Responsibilities

  • Create, manage, and edit transaction documents, including client profile, property information, transaction details, and other confidential materials using Microsoft suits and internal company system.
  • Greet and answer clients via phone, email and in-person in a welcoming and professional manner.
  • Handle sensitive information including cheques and orders, ensuring all information is secured and accurate.
  • Assist with preparation, formatting, proof writing and distribution of documents including contract, promotion materials, and other confidential materials.
  • Managing and updating social media advertising (Facebook/Instagram, etc.)
  • Assist in the preparation of listings, MLS drafts and open houses and coordinating with various vendors and suppliers
  • Arrange showings and prepare showing materials
  • Prepare, compile, scan and photocopy documents for trade records, lawyers, mortgage brokers, etc and file documents
  • General errands and tasks like installing lockboxes, arranging key exchanges, pick ups of various items or cheques from tenants
  • Data entry, expense tracking, light bookkeeping
  • Drive within GTA to complete tasks as required (additional expenses, such as gas will be covered)

Job Requirements

  • A college or a university degree
  • Fluent communication ability in English
  • Attentive and detail oriented.
  • 40 hours per week with 8 hour per shift. 2-3 Night shifts and 1 weekend shift

Experience/Familiarity preferred with:

  • TRREB
  • WEBForms/authentisign (or similar programs) to prepare offers, listings and related forms
  • CRM - data entry
  • Preparing listing and Buying packages
  • Organizing service for Listing marketing
  • File management
  • RECO compliance, FINTRAC compliance, standard real estate transactional paperwork (APS, Waivers, Listings Agreements, etc.)

Valued traits and skills:

  • A great communicator
  • Organized
  • Punctual
  • A great team player

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $18.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license and own car (required)

title: Junior Digital Marketing Assistant
description:
Junior Digital Marketing Assistant

Are you looking for an opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of digital marketing? IMP is seeking a creative, energetic and detail-oriented Junior Digital Marketing Assistant to join our team. In this role, you will work with our team to develop and create creative designs for pay-per-click advertising, social media, email marketing and more using your graphic design and web development skills. There is also the opportunity to learn about campaign development and execution for these areas.

Come join a fun and knowledgeable team of digital marketing professionals in a flexible growth-driven work environment. Our existing team of 19 passionate experts loves working with our clients to help grow their business. Work with some of the most well-known hot tub and spa brands. Enjoy the benefits of a 6-hour workday, 12 days paid vacation right from the start, an extra paid day off for your birthday, a flexible remote work environment and a robust library of tools to define our team as the leading agency for the pool and hot tub industry. Read what our clients say about us and view our work.

Duties

  • Provide stellar support to Account Managers on projects and client retainer work
  • Creation and design of industry-leading emails
  • Dive into all digital assets for quality control and review
  • Assist with daily community management of client social media channels
  • Collaborate with team members to create remarkable graphic design pieces
  • Design unforgettable PPC ads for social media, google, display and connected TV campaigns
  • Become an officer of the brand to ensure all client and brand guidelines are followed
  • Participation in regular team meetings and collaboration sessions

Skills

  • Graphic design skills using Adobe Suite, Canva, Creatopy
  • 1+ years of experience working in B2C digital marketing
  • Functional knowledge of social media platforms
  • Email marketing design and deployment
  • Base knowledge/experience of Adobe Suite
  • Ability to stay organized and meet project deadlines
  • WordPress/Shopify dev experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Previous experience with SalesForce, SharpSpring or Accelo is an asset

Why Work Here?

An amazing culture with flexible hours and work from home. Enhance your skills by learning from your team and work on exciting client projects.

Please include graphic design work samples or portfolio with your application.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $40,000.00-$45,000.00 per year

title: Real Estate Assistant
description:
Position Requirements

This is an ideal opportunity to work with one of the top agents in Edmonton.

Previous experience in a Real Estate Assistant role or Real Estate Representative role is a MUST. Graduates of a recognized legal assistant/paralegal program will fit this role as well.

Excellent oral communication and writing skills; an artistic eye for the development of Real Estate Brochures, Ads and Property Descriptions

Strong computer skills (Word and Outlook); ability to adapt to new software systems. Social media and advertising media management experience

Exceptional interpersonal skills and professionalism; ability to act with tact and diplomacy

Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines. Good organizational and time management skills and the ability to prioritize and handle time sensitive projects effectively

A positive self-starter who can take initiative; require excellent attention to details

High integrity, ability to maintain confidentiality is essential

Reliable transportation and the ability to travel locally as required

This is a flexible/hybrid schedule which will require occasionally work outside normal office hours

Listing & Sales/Purchase Administration:

Responsible for preparing and drafting a variety of complex documents

Liaise with sales representatives, lawyers and financial institutions

Broker loading of listings, listings update management

Actively advance files with minimal instruction - conditions follow up, lawyer information, trade record details, vendor/buyer letters

Preparing write ups for new listings feature sheets and brochures

Advertising preparation and submission

Maintain and manage deadlines and online systems

Client Care Functions:

Provide high quality service to clients; making certain clients are kept informed throughout the process

Generating weekly reports with feedback summaries, number of showings for past week, number of web and video views

Assistance Preparing CMAs, Pre-List or Buyer Packages for appointments

Ensuring the accuracy and maintenance of the client database / files

Office Administration Functions:

Answering phone and email inquiries

Organizing and confirming showing requests for listings

Booking showings for buyers

Crafting communications on behalf of manager

Updating content for social media and website(s) management

Office procedures reference binders

Technology and systems administration functions

All other duties as may be assigned

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50,000.00-$55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Day shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Office is limited to maximum 3 personnel at any time.

Experience:

  • Real Estate related: 1 year (required)

title: Assistant Category Manager Canada and USA - Season and Household Categories
description:
Americas - JOB DESCRIPTION

Job Description for: Assistant Category Manager (Canada & US) for Seasonal and Household categories
Reports to: Category Manager
Direct reports: None
Location: Toronto (or Montreal)

Qualifications:

Education and Experience
- University Degree in Marketing/Business Management
- Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience

Brand building, product management, & marketing experience in a CPG or relevant industry
Experience with Digital Marketing & Ecommerce is mandatory

Creative & Analytical mindset: demonstrated successful project management, marketing campaign planning & execution, cross functional team interaction, new product launches (with metrics), developed new ideas and perspectives, experienced in building innovation plans in a competitive market environment

Communication skills
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Ability to create presentations and to present to small groups as well as large audiences
- Good written skills for creating business plans, proposals, internal reports

Technical skills
- Ability to analyze market, consumer researches and business KPI reports, to interpret data, to identify trends and to make recommendations
- Lead label designing and packaging process
- Good knowledge of budgeting and pricing strategy
- Proven ability to develop product & marketing strategies and communicate recommendations to management
- Experience in briefing agencies (both research and advertising), in evaluating their work and giving feedback
- Strong proficiency in digital, social media and e-commerce as platforms to reach consumers
- Excellent technical aptitude with understanding of products specifications and usage, experience in new product development and product launches across multiple channels

Computer Skills
- Good working knowledge of Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
- Experience on photoshop will be an asset
- Strong ability to quickly learn tools to effectively run analysis (ex: PowerBi, Salesforce, DataStudio…)

Responsibilities
- Develop insightful business updates on regular basis
- Manage Innovation, Retail execution projects working in tandem with cross functional teams
- Define the vision and establish a clear portfolio approach (inclusive of sku rationalization) across the different brands
- Develop a roadmap for ongoing innovation projects and new ideas for respective categories
- Work in close collaboration with R&D and regulatory for all product related enquiries and developments
- Create the marketing plans to support the brands and launches
- Work effectively with advertising, promotional, research agencies, consultants, vendors, etc.
- Collaborate with the Sales team to ensure the execution of the marketing plans with the key retailers/customers
- Assist on go-to-market strategy for the US market

Personality fit:

- A strong team player
- Seeks business and personal growth
- Ownership of business categories while delivering creative and analytical business solutions
- High level of business ethics

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $69,600.00-$85,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Wellness program
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Publishing Intern
description:
Job Posting: Publishing Assistant
Summer 2022 Youth Work Opportunity

Lion's Roar, North America’s largest Buddhist media company, has the ideal work situation for a youth wanting to explore the business side of publishing this summer. The successful candidate will apply their skills and knowledge to the operations side of our continuously growing print and digital publishing business.

What will I do?

You’ll work on a range of projects over the summer. Depending on your strengths and current priorities at Lion’s Roar you could:

  • Use statistical methods to analyze data, generate business reports, and guide business decisions
  • Identify and recommend new ways to streamline business processes
  • Use data to create models that depict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a whole
  • Work with departmental managers to outline the specific data needs for each business method analysis project
  • Develop business performance dashboards
  • Research software tools and best practices
  • Create and populate a database of content and contributors
  • Support advertising department with Web research, lead generation, mass-outreach campaign
  • Assist with online survey creation and results tabulation
  • Assist with configuration and testing of Wordpress plugins

What do I need:

  • Experience with HTML and CSS would be an asset.
  • Education in Business & Management or Computer Science & Technology preferred but not required
  • Ability to help develop analysis of results & interpretation of data.
  • Assist in development & troubleshooting of new algorithms and software.
  • A “can-do” attitude and excitement about problem-solving and critical thinking
  • Attention to detail

How do I apply?

Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada and be between the ages of 15 and 30.

To apply please send a covering letter and resume with "Publishing Assistant" in the heading to Cindy Littlefair. Work begins in May.

Salary: $15.00 per hour for a 30-hour workweek

For more information about Lion’s Roar see lionsroar.com

Job Type: Internship / Co-op
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: $15.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Covid protocols are in place.

Application deadline: 2022-05-31
Expected start date: 2022-05-23

Show more
